dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pristine water. Perfect sand. Not a trace of garbage or e seaweed. This is the beach as it should exist. A ripped surfer shreds an early morning wave. Two Califor beauties dip their feet in the water, chasing the surf. A sand-sculptor makes an amazing castle. God it’s awesome h Drums start. Music is beginning to build. And now, the sh that made BAYWATCH the biggest show on planet Earth:

dialogues.speaker: CJ PARKER
dialogues.text: a beautiful blonde bombshell of a LIFEGUARD with a red re can jogs past the beachgoers in glorious sun-dripped slo- motion. She looks to a LIFEGUARD TOWER where a tall brune

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE HOLDEN
dialogues.text: emerges, making notations about the tidal conditions on a clipboard. She nods to CJ, all business. Attractive but conservative, she looks to her watch, expectant. Everyone on the beach now turns. Women, men, children, th old, the young, they all ready themselves... .--for it’s time for ‘IT’ to happen:

dialogues.speaker: OCEAN
dialogues.text: The water is calm, almost a sheet of glass. After a coupl of beats, however... BUBBLES begin to appear. Just a few first... but then more. There’s something down there. Something rising. Is it a sea beast? No, it’s -- 6-FOOT 5-INCHES, 255 POUNDS OF PURE MUSCLE & GRIT. A tann strapping package of ‘Fuck Yeah!’ -- rising out of the oc like Godzilla -- covered by only a pair of red swim trunk with a ‘BAYWATCH’ emblem. This is

dialogues.speaker: MITCH BUCHANAN
dialogues.text: He probably just swam 5 miles, but he isn’t even out of breath. He turns to the ocean and makes a series of loud CLICKING SOUNDS. What the hell is he doing? Just then, THREE DOLPHINS emerge, responding to his call, ‘tail-walking’ on the water. Incredible. Mitch grins:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: ‘Mornin’, ladies! Mitch now begins his morning run. We follow him as he pas -- THE BEACHCOMBER SNACK SHACK (exchanging a ‘Sup nod wi its elderly FILIPINO OWNER). -- THE PIER (where fishermen are hauling fresh catch to t trucks; one worker tosses Mitch a hunk of sushi-grade tun which he catches with one hand. Takes a bite. Approves.) -- BASKETBALL COURTS. 10 BALLERS are in the middle of a f court game. Just as a streaking player goes up for a dunk however -- Mitch meets him mid-air and swats the ball awa

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS BALLERS
dialogues.text: Ohhhhhh/Shiiiiiitttt! /Dammmmm! The rejected baller is pissed... until he sees it was Mit (who’s just smiling back, continuing his run).

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Not in my house, Darnell. And DARNELL is actually cool with it. As if being blocked Mitch was some kind of honor.

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Motherfuckin’ Mitch Buchanan! Brother saved my Nana’s life. I ever tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: BALLER
dialogues.text: Every time he jogs by. Literally every single time.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, FURTHER ALONG ON HIS RUN
dialogues.text: He passes LUXURY BEACH HOMES... when he’s hit in the head a bikini top. He stops, looks up at the source, finding: smoking hot WOMAN standing on her balcony, wearing only t matching bottoms. Mitch smiles up at her.

dialogues.speaker: TOPLESS WOMAN
dialogues.text: Ooops. Finish your workout up here?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Sheilaaaaa... you’re married. You know I don’t swim in other men’s waters. Her HUSBAND comes out, cradling his morning cup of coffee calls down:

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND
dialogues.text: For you, Mitch? I'd make an exception!  Mitch laughs and points up at him -- you dog! He keeps running, leaving her deeply disappointed. He turns to her

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, if you’re in the mood --

dialogues.speaker: TOPLESS WOMAN
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, Howard, I can’t face your tired dick right now.

dialogues.speaker: ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: A bit-overweight black COP sits on an idling beach patrol ATV, writing someone a ticket for littering. Mitch joggin by, turns backwards --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Hey, Ellerbee -- why don’t you get off that Rascal and join me? Ellerbee laughs but we can see he’s putting on a fake smi

dialogues.speaker: ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: All-Terrain-Vehicle, Mitch! Police Issued All-Terrain-Vehicle hahaha -- (softer, to himself) -- you sunbaked sonofabitch. BUFF MEN & WOMEN PUMP IRON AT A MUSCLE BEACH-LIKE GYM... Mitch has stopped his run, and we see he’s yelling at peo thru an intense workout, helping them train --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (to his left) That's right, brother, push! You think your tank’s empty? It isn’t empty until you say it’s empty! (to his right) Is your tank empty, Brittany? REVEAL: Mitch has two 8YR-OLDS doing chin-ups on his outstretched arms. Other kids wait for their turns.

dialogues.speaker: BRITTANY
dialogues.text: I... am... Diesel!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH IS RUNNING AGAIN
dialogues.text: He passes a HOMELESS MAN (HOBO JOE) with a filthy beard a longshoreman's hat asleep on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Hey, Hobo Joe -- how’s it hangin’?  Seemingly still asleep, Hobo Joe raises a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE HUNTLEY CLUB
dialogues.text: A private beach club right on the water which oozes money exclusivity. TWO YOUNG SURFERS are being chased off by a tough-looking SECURITY GUARD. Mitch stops his run --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There a problem, Scoot? The Young Surfer responds with absolutely incoherent surf lingo. Mitch nods, understanding. We have to read subtitl

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SURFER
dialogues.text: <This not very bright security guard claims we cannot surf here. He says it is private property.>

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Nobody owns this beach except the people who pay my salary -- the good citizens of the Bay. The Security Guard is huge, bald, thick beard. Anyone els would be intimidated, but not Mitch. Mitch holds the Guar intense stare, but speaks to the surfers:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go shred. We got 10 to 12 foot swellers with a primo off shore blower and tasty barrels for days. The Surfers give Mitch a series of impossibly complex han shakes which Mitch perfectly matches move for move, his s never leaving the Guard, who now steps like he’s gonna fi

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS, (0S)
dialogues.text: S'Alright! It’s OK, Frankie! The surfers take off as Mitch turns and sees a charming AUSTRALIAN BUSINESSMAN approaching with hand-outstretched BRAXTON LEEDS (CONT’D) It’s Lieutenant Buchanan, right? You're kindofa legend ‘round here! Mitch doesn’t take his hand, still in beast mode.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: This beach isn’t private. It’s public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it is! Apologies, my guys get a little protective of the Member's space sometimes, but you're absolutely right. (beat) I’m Braxton Leeds, new owner of the Huntley Club.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Right. Still waiting on my application to be approved. They both laugh knowingly, a little edge to Mitch’s.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Believe me, I don’t think they’d let me in the bloody place if I didn’t own it. But hey, you come by any time, lunch is on me... for you and your squad. No hard feelin’s. Mitch is still a little skeptical, but puts out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Bay. They shake. And as Mitch resumes his run, the giant Secur Guard (FRANKIE) comes to Leeds’s side, their faces both n serious and, frankly, a touch menacing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: You want me to stay on him?

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: It’s well in hand. Go handle today’s delivery...

dialogues.speaker: A COUPLE OF YOUNG GUYS ON THE BEACH
dialogues.text: early 20s tops, are setting up their beach chairs on the sand. One of them is a little on the chubby side (RONNIE) he’s carefully angling his long slatted beach-chair in a different direction than his friend.

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: Aren’t you facing the wrong way?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Trust me. The guy follows Ronnie’s gaze to a LIFEGUARD TOWER and se CJ Parker emerge, covering her arms and chest in sunblock her watchful gaze never leaving the people swimming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who... is that?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: She’s the most beautiful woman in the world. Ronnie sits down and EVERYTHING SLOWS AGAIN as CJ turns, throwing back her hair. Ronnie is in a trance. Music in h head builds. God, she really is gorgeous. Long toned legs Clear blue eyes that seem to be calling to us... Ronnie casually pulls a towel over his lap. And then, lik sudden splash of cold water --

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE GIRL, (0S)
dialogues.text: Hey you guys know where the snack shack is?? Before she can even finish her sentence, Ronnie FLIPS OVE he’s laying on his stomach -- showing only his back to he

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: Uh... no. Sorry. They're weirded out, but leave. The friend starts to gigg Suddenly, Ronnie tries to turn back over -- but can’t.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Hey man -- I’m stuck! Help -- His friend leans over, looks under the chair and winces. There’s something stuck poking between the slats...

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: OH JESUS! How did you --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Do something, man! His friend looks around, has no idea what to do.

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: Uhhhhh, I’m not gonna touch your --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: c’MON!

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: Help! Help, my friend needs help!

dialogues.speaker: WHAT ARE YOU DOING
dialogues.text: And like a dog hearing a whistle, MITCH whips his head in their direction, and starts running over --

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, dude -- I’m sorry!

dialogues.speaker: DON'T YOU LEAVE ME HERE MAN
dialogues.text: The ‘Friend’ high-tails it out of there as Mitch arrives.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You call for help?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: NO -- UHHH, that was -- UHHH --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Just calm down. What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Ronnie.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: OK, Ronnie. I’m Mitch, and I’m here to help. What’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Uhhh... I seem to be... uh, stuck? To this chair? My... uh, my... Mitch kneels down, peeks under the chair.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. You’ve got your junk in a jam.

dialogues.speaker: YES
dialogues.text: Mitch puts a comforting hand on his back. Mitch looks aro surveying the scene. Sees CJ nearby in the tower.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (clinical) OK, I think I see what happened here. You were fantasizing about that lifeguard over there, and then, you began to masturbate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: It’s perfectly natural to be attracted to her, Ronnie. Common everyday biology. But I can’t have that kind of behavior on my beach.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I didn’t -- I swear! I was just --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: It’s OK. But her name is CJ Parker, and she’s not an object. She’s a lifeguard, here to do a critical job. Do you understand that? Ronnie nods, face in the chair -- genuinely understanding

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I do. I do.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: How’s the swelling. Has my calm demeanor helped?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: (voice cracking) Uhhhhh frankly? No.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Blood flow must be impeded. You're cinched off, that bad-boy ain't goin’ down. Alright, we’re gonna have to stand you up, pal. CJ! Need your assistance over here!

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: NO NO PLEASE DON’T CALL HER! CJ jogs over, sun glistening off her wet skin. Ronnie shu his eyes tight, afraid to even look at her. Co What’s up, Mitch?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Funny you should ask. On three, we're gonna help up my new friend Ronnie here. One... two... three! Mitch and CJ stand Ronnie (and the beach chair) up on end and CJ gets a flash of --  Co Ooops, we got Towel Tent. We can see Ronnie’s mortified eyes through the chair slat

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: You know what, just kill me, OK?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, this'll all be over in a sec. We’re gonna have to cut it --

dialogues.speaker: MY DICK
dialogues.text: Still stuck to the chair, Ronnie takes off with tiny awkw steps. Kids run and scream as he trips and FALLS INTO the sand-castle. With a moan, Ronnie rolls over, free of the chair! Mitch looks after him, knife in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No...the chair, but that works too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATT BRODY (20s) is cruising into town on his motorcycle, duffle bag strapped to the side of his bike. Nearing the beach, he stops at a light as BEAUTIFUL GIRLS in swimsuit cross in front of him. His eyes try to take it all in.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: ‘Scuse me, girls? Which way to the Bay? Two incredibly hot young beauties turn and point down the street, and wave goodbye as he flashes a perfect smile.

dialogues.speaker: THE BAY
dialogues.text: Glorious hustle and bustle under the warm California sun. Tourists walk past street musicians, food booths, a huge Mexican dude selling hand-carved wooden pelicans, a caricature artist, and finally, we end on -- A BANNER: A picture of Matt Brody in a speedo, an OLYMPIC GOLD MEDAL around his neck. Under it, Brody sits alone at booth smiling. A few lonely balloons blow in the wind. His HANDLER, a sharply dressed woman, stands out front.

dialogues.speaker: HANDLER
dialogues.text: Come meet Matt Brody, world-class Olympic swimmer! Today only!  10. Tourists walk past his ‘Autographs $15’ without giving hi second look. Brody looks over, sees a long line waiting f the $20 Caricatures. He sits back, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: TOURIST
dialogues.text: Hey, I think I remember you. Beijing, right? (squints at the banner) But... you never won gold, did you?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was a mix up at the printers. So... you want an autograph? You get a picture too.

dialogues.speaker: TOURIST
dialogues.text: Yeah... Brody. Brody. There was something else about you... Behind the tourist there are two young PUNKS huddled arou an iPad, playing a video, laughing their asses off, steal looks at Brody. Brody’s heart sinks. TOURIST (CONT’D) Wait, you got DQ’d, right? What was it... You were sick...?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Next in line! Anybody?! No one else is interested. More kids huddled around the i now, watching a VIDEO, whispering and laughing about Brod

dialogues.speaker: LEAD PUNK
dialogues.text: Uh... yeah, lemme get a photo! Brody forces a smile, and the punk goes over to Brody and holds up the iPad next to him: On the looped VIDEO, we se 18yr-old HUNGOVER Brody on the starting blocks, about to start a race, only he VOMITS into the pool. Over and over

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Yeah?? You wish your shit went viral!

dialogues.speaker: WATCHING ACROSS THE WAY
dialogues.text: is a YOUNG WAITRESS at the BEACHCOMBER SNACK SHACK. This

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: young, cute, honest and hard-working, wearing cut off sho over a black bathing suit. She looks a little sorry for Brody... but then looks to something just past his booth:  11. A sign that says LIFEGUARD TRY-OUTS 11:30am TODAY!

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: (looking at her watch) Mr. Sang? Can I take my break now? An older Filipino man (SANG) in a cook’s outfit comes ove and puts a warm hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SANG
dialogues.text: Sang know where you going. Good luck. She smiles back at him, starts to untie her apron strings

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BRODY
dialogues.text: Brody is on his cell phone, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Well, Mike was supposed to cover my shifts! Mr. Franklin, I can’t get back by then, I just drove my bike all the cross country, it'd take me three days to -- no, but -- (listens) No, please... I need that job, Mr. Franklin! Mr. Franklin?! Just then a sweet smiling angelic 9 YEAR OLD BOY comes up

dialogues.speaker: NINE YEAR OLD
dialogues.text: Will you sign this?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: (puts away his phone) Sure, what the hell. REVEAL: It’s a caricature from the booth next door of an exaggerated Brody puking into a pool, giving the finger t the US flag with ‘FUCK YOU AMERICA.’ Brody is stunned, lo back to the kid who now has a shit-eating grin.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, kid. There is no Santa Claus.

dialogues.speaker: NINE YEAR OLD
dialogues.text: No shit, Barf-olomew. Brody makes like he’s gonna smack the kid, and he runs of just as SUMMER walks by, catching Brody’s eye. Brody slow stands, eyes locked on her as --  12.

dialogues.speaker: HANDLER
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry about today, Brody. I really thought we’d get more --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: S’'OK. I’m takin’ a break -- Brody hurries to follow Summer --

dialogues.speaker: LIFEGUARD SIGN UP TABLE
dialogues.text: Stephanie, the all-business lifeguard we met earlier, sit behind a fold-out table, signing in applicants. There’s a long line, Summer toward the back. First up, is Ronnie.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Hey, I remember you... Ronnie, right? You wanna be a lifeguard? Ronnie’s eyes are LOCKED on CJ talking to Mitch in the b.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Uhh... Yeah, totally. After you guys saved me? I just, want to be a part of this. What you guys do. I wanna be near -- (really clocking CJ) -- the action. Around it. (barely a whisper) Inside it... CJ turns to him, recognizing him, and waves warmly.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: is waiting patiently in line when Brody cuts everyone to stand next to her. Everyone complains, but Brody ignores them. He sidles up to Summer like they were at a bar...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, gonna have to ask you to step out of line.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Why’s that?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: ‘Cuz you’re makin’ all the other girls here look bad.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Has that line ever worked for you? I mean, outside of a HOOTERS?  13.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: First time I’ve tried it. Thanks for the cuts. So you know how much this job pays? Thinking about signing up...

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: You don’t become a lifeguard for the money. You do it because you wanna help people, to save lives.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Oh, me too, me too, absolutely. But you know, I’m thinkin’ of renting a place. Somethin’ nice, right on the beach. You live around here?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: You want something nice on the sand that’s about 5-10k a month... Brody almost chokes.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO STEPHANIE AND RONNIE
dialogues.text: Ronnie has finished the paperwork, hands it to Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: OK, now take off your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Uh... my shirt? What does that have to, uhh... I mean you're judging me based on my -- Stephanie holds up a grease pen.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Everybody gets a number.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Ohhh. Of course. But Ronnie just stands there. Reaaally doesn’t wanna take that shirt.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh you know what? I didn’t bring any sunblock, so maybe I should -- Stephanie holds up sunblock, with a smile that’s losing patience. Ronnie nods and reluctantly sheds his shirt, revealing pale skin. People in line mock cover their eyes from the “glare”. And then when Ronnie turns around --  14. Well, let’s just say it. He has a small dense patch of da hair around each nipple, and is hairless everywhere else. There are a few snickers. And then --

dialogues.speaker: DICK IN LINE
dialogues.text: Nice nipple-fros, bro! The handsome Dick laughs, and fist-bumps his buddy.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: You there. What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: DICK IN LINE
dialogues.text: Zayne.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Step out of line, Zayne. Lifeguards support one another. You’re out. The Dick is stunned stupid, mouth agape, then finally mov Brody steps around him, putting a hand to his mouth --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: (mock amazement to Summer) Daayummm! (to Stephanie) Hi, Matt Brody. Here to join up.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Fill out this form and then --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Actually -- (reading name tag) -- Stephanie, I think we can skip all the paperwork. I’m already an experienced lifeguard. Elite swimmer...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Is that so? Brody sheds his shirt happily revealing a ripped physique He smiles to Summer, then back to Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Sorry -- I just had a burrito, so I’m a little bloated.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Regardless of experience, everyone needs to fill out Sections 1 thru 20. No need to read the fine print. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It just indemnifies us in the event of your death during tryouts. Stephanie roughly spins Brody around, then writes a big Z on his back and arms with the thick grease marker.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Zero? Cool, I can work with that. From zero to hero. (to Summer) So, beautiful, you know my number. Seems unfair I don’t know yours... Summer rolls her eyes, pushes past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braxton Leeds is behind a desk when Frankie comes in --

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Shipment today was 2 kilos short.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Who was the pilot?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: Marco. One of their guys. Leeds looks off, not happy about this. Out the window, he sees Mitch lining up all of his wannabe lifeguards.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Keep him here. We can use him. Kill two birds with one stone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch, Stephanie and CJ address the twenty or so applican before tryouts begin. There’s an obstacle course set up o the sand (cones, ropes, CPR dummies) and nerves are palpa

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What is Baywatch? Ronnie raises his hand... before seeing it was rhetorical

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Baywatch is the heart and soul of this beach. It’s the reason the single mother behind me feels comfortable letting her two kids run unaccompanied into the water.  16. The applicants watch as that exact scene plays out behind Mitch. Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we don’t do our job the right way -- people will die. If you work at a bank and you don’t pay attention? Maybe somebody gets shorted a few bucks. If you don’t pay attention here? Say it with me--

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: People will die. Stephanie adds:

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Baywatch isn’t just a job. It’s a calling. So if you aren’t here for the right reasons... (gives Brody a look) ..»-you might as well leave now. CJ? Co There are a maximum of three spots available for the summer season. So, big bummer, the rest of you will have to wait til next year. Ronnie whispers to Brody next to him as he watches CJ --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Only three spots? I can’t go back to working at Best Buy, man. I'd rather die on the sand near her than live in a showroom alone.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Two spots maximum. One of ‘em’s already mine. Sorry. Mitch comes up, stares Brody down like a drill sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You say something, sand-jockey?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing. But, as I was explaining to Stephanie over there, I’m an experienced lifeguard.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Lifeguard, huh. What body of water did you protect?  17.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Body of water? Nah, man. Wet World Water Park, Sandusky Ohio. Head Lifeguard, last eight months. Mitch turns to Stephanie, who stifles a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Ohio?! Hey, Stephanie -- they got any oceans in Ohio?!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Nope! Just overconfident dickbags, apparently!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Wet World gets five thousand visitors a day. I know what I’m doing... Mitch zeros in on Brody and the others shrink away.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Do you, pool boy? What, you think yelling ‘no cuts’ and warning little Bobby Sherman not to run with slippery bare feet qualifies you to protect my Bay?!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Are you being serious right now?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Dead serious, Splash Zone. And our ‘deep end’ is the Marianna trench, and it ain’t 12 feet, it’s 36 thousand. We know more about the surface of Mars than what’s down there, and you’re tellin’ me you know what you're doing?!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: No, I’m telling you to give me any swim test you got, and I'll beat anybody here.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: There’s more to Baywatch than being fast in the water. It’s about going above and beyond. So why don’t you tell me why you’re really here?! Brody exchanges a look with Summer. He’s here because she hot and he needs money. But... he remembers what she said  18.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Uhhh because... I wanna help people. To save lives, man.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: ‘Man’?! That's Lieutenant to you.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: For real? Like in the Army? Mitch steps back and folds his arms as Stephanie shouts:

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: No, like in the motherfuckin’ Baywatch. Now let’s MOVE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie has a clipboard in hand, taking notes as the applicants go through a number of grueling challenges: -- carrying sandbags up a hill -- running through cones on the beach -- free-diving and picking up markers from the ocean floo In every event, there are a couple who fall out. This is tough stuff. BRODY, however, is kicking ass.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: falls in the sand, others trampling on his back, going ar him. He looks exhausted, about to quit. That’s when he se CJ stretching. A fire suddenly burns deep within him --

dialogues.speaker: GRRRAAAIGGHHH
dialogues.text: And he forces himself up and moving, shoving others aside

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: Brody is in his element. He’s far and away the best swimm and he pulls away. As he rounds a buoy, he even switches the backstroke, just to show he can. He calls to Summer -

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Hey, you’re pretty good too! After this, where we gonna go to celebrate? Summer ignores him, tosses some floating SEA WEED at Brod with her next stroke as she makes the turn, doing her bes  19.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Brody can swim, no question.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No surprise there. Like to drown that attitude, though.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: Applicants drag a plank via a rope over their shoulder. Ronnie near the back of the pack, but still swimming, giv it everything he has. Then he notices something --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Baby!! None of the others listen, all focused on finishing. Ronn detaches his plank and goes after it. Mitch and CJ on sho take notice. Co Where’s he going? When Ronnie finally makes it to the baby, however, he see was just a DOLL. He shouts to shore --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: False alarm! False alarm, everyone!! It’s just a doll! From the shore, CJ and Mitch watch. Mitch looks skeptical Co Awww. He’s got good energy, Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I've seen better swimmers in the Minnow Class at the Y. Co But think of the courage it took to come here and try out after what happened to him last week!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: True. Thing looked like a turtle got his head caught in a mousetrap. Mitch nods to himself. She’s winning him over. Ronnie sho

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: This gonna count against my time?!  20.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BEACH
dialogues.text: There are only eight applicants left, and they’re on thei knees, sucking wind. Brody stands, fresh as a daisy.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Who wants to go again?! Mitch ignores him, looks to Summer who is completely spen He smiles at her, impressed with her effort.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: That completes tryouts. The results will be posted momentarily. Thank you for your interest in being a Baywatch Lifeguard, and good luck to you all. Brody grins, knows he’s got this sewn up.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH IN THE LIFEGUARD TOWER
dialogues.text: He’s got BINOCULARS POV on the HUNTLEY CLUB. A truck with “AL’S FISH CO.” on the side pulls to the loa dock. Frankie and a shorter wiry guy (LEON) move DARK BAR from the truck into the club. Moments later, other barrel from the club into the truck. Curious...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE RESULTS BOARD
dialogues.text: Applicants crowd around the sheet. Some turn, disappointe Summer pushes her way in... and sees her name. She beams.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: I made it. I made it! Ronnie almost forces himself to look, then --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Oh my God... me too! I can’t believe it. I’m gonna be a Lifeguard! I’m not even gonna give Best Buy notice -- shit, I'll lose my video game discount -- screw it! Everyone looks to him, can’t believe it either. Brody smi

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Way to go, guys! I’m glad they made room for three of us.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Actually... I think it’s just two.  21. Brody's face falls. He looks at the list --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What -- are you kidding me?! Brody marches toward the lifeguard tower. Mitch is alone the top like a King surveying his realm.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was the best one out there and you know it! I mean... you’re takin’ Chunky Style over me?! Summer and Ronnie come over --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Hey! I lost like four pounds today!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Ronnie’s got heart. I can mold him. He wants to be part of a team. You're irresponsible, you’re afraid to be a part of something larger than yourself. I ain’t got room for a lone wolf in my pack.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: This is such bullshit! Mitch ignores him now, eyes on the horizon. There’s a HOT BALLOON lazily drifting over the ocean...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give me another chance, man! This isn’t fair! (barely a whisper) I got nowhere else to go... Summer watches, feels a little bad for him. Mitch slowly rises... reaches for his BINOCULARS... done with Brody.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Go back to the pool. You’re not ready for the Bay...

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE OCEAN
dialogues.text: There is a YOUNG COUPLE inside the basket of the hot air balloon. She’s in a wheelchair, and she looks very nervou

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN BALLOON
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, we’re so high up now. Are you sure this is --  22.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BALLOON
dialogues.text: Janie? She turns, and sees now that he’s on one knee, holding op box with a DIAMOND RING inside. MAN IN BALLOON (CONT’D) Will you marry me?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN BALLOON
dialogues.text: Oh my god... Uh... yes! (looking over, nervous) But can we go back down??

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BALLOON
dialogues.text: Of course! You’ve made me the happiest guy in the world. They kiss, she’s happy. And then he whips out his phone. MAN IN BALLOON (CONT’D) Let’s just get a quick engagement selfie! Her face falls as he awkwardly scoots BEHIND her wheelcha

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BEACH TOWER
dialogues.text: Mitch has his binoculars trained on the balloon. He can s that the guy is leaning WAY BACK over the edge of the basket’s edge. Mitch grabs his two-way, all business.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Got a possible thirty-six niner off Tower 16...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What? What’s going on? CJ grabs her RED RESCUE CAN, is already starting to move

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HOT AIR BALLOON
dialogues.text: The man is desperately trying to take a selfie with both them in the frame -- but there’s not enough room for him

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN BALLOON
dialogues.text: Let’s just take them when we're back on the beach, OK -- ??

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BALLOON
dialogues.text: We gotta capture the moment it happened! Can you just -- like, lean back?  23. He’s jockeying -- oh man, this isn’t safe -- he’s sitting the edge now -- MAN IN BALLOON (CONT’D) Big smiles, this isn’t just for my You Tube channel, this is for your Mom on Facebook too -- OK, OK, right there -- look happy!

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN BALLOON
dialogues.text: Haaaappyyyyy -- SQUAWK! A seagull flies too close -- and smacks him in th head. HE FALLS BACK!

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN BALLOON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you get it? David...?

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE ON THE BEACH GAWK
dialogues.text: as a man falls a hundred feet and SLAMS into the water!

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS BEACHGOERS
dialogues.text: Ohhhhhhh!/Damn!/No way he’s alive! CJ dives in the water with her rescue can. Brody sees Mit and Stephanie running down the shore, leaving them behind

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: What should we -- Brody looks again to the ocean, and starts running --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Coast Guard Chopper is in San Diego! Take at least an hour -- We’re gonna have to improvise --

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The wind whistles as the balloon rises. She leans over th edge trying to see him. God she’s high up. WOMAN IN BALLOON (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: LEAVE ME UP HERE
dialogues.text: She looks above her at the TWO CORDS that control up and down.  24. She raises her hands but they’re just out of reach and obviously she can’t stand! She streeetches -- reeeaaachin fingertips just able to sway them --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH AND STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: jump into the yellow RESCUE TRUCK parked on the sand like pros. Stephanie hits the sirens as Mitch punches it, send sand spraying and sticking right on a guy’s face who just applied suntan lotion, turning him into a sand sculpture.

dialogues.speaker: THE OPEN WATER
dialogues.text: CJ is swimming, fast -- and out of nowhere, moving like a knife through butter -- Brody overtakes her!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE HUNTLEY BEACH CLUB
dialogues.text: A wealthy CLUB MEMBER is struggling to put on a parasail vest, ropes running from it to a waiting boat just off sh Behind him, the RESCUE TRUCK skids, Mitch jumping out bef it’s even completely stopped, running straight for the parasail rig. Stephanie goes to the boat --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Here, let me help you with that. The Club Member turns, assumes Mitch works for the Club.

dialogues.speaker: CLUB MEMBER
dialogues.text: Finally! The problem is it’s chaffing the ol’ coin purse. But when he turns, he sees Mitch is putting it on himself Stephanie jumps into the boat over the driver's protests

dialogues.speaker: HUNTLEY BOAT DRIVER
dialogues.text: Hey, I can’t let you take this!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That’s a terrible attitude. You can do anything you put your mind to. VVVRRROOOOMMM! Stephanie guns the boat as FRANKIE the Security Guard sees what’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogues.text: You! Frankie runs at Mitch as the boat takes off, the line goi taught. And as Mitch is pulled into the air, Frankie jump and grabs his legs -- bringing them BOTH up -- but Franki quickly falls off, and falls into the water.  25.

dialogues.speaker: OPEN WATER
dialogues.text: CJ gets to the spot where he hit the water just as Brody erupts thru the surface, the unconscious guy in his arm! Co Here! CJ throws him the red rescue can and Brody grabs it --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STILL-ASCENDING HOT AIR BALLOON
dialogues.text: The basket buffets from the wind and the wheelchair rolls back and forth, careening. She puts the breaks on --

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: This is what I get for putting myself out there. (to the heavens) Fuck you, E-Harmony!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH IS PARASAILING TOWARD THE BALLOON
dialogues.text: Stephanie is down below, driving the boat. As they get closer, though, it becomes clear Mitch lacks enough rope reach the balloon. And the gap keeps growing. With zero hesitation, Mitch detaches himself from the rop shooting himself higher into the sky!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BASKET
dialogues.text: The girl has her eyes closed, doing a silent prayer when WHAM! -- the basket rocks. Mitch has grabbed on!

dialogues.speaker: OH MY GOD
dialogues.text: Mouth agape, she watches him climb in like out of a dream removes his parasail (casually, as if he was taking off h jacket) and expertly pulls the cord controls.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You did want to go down, right? She forces herself to nod her head, and he smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SHORE
dialogues.text: Brody and CJ are doing CPR on the unconscious Balloon Guy Clearly, Brody knows what he’s doing. Summer looks on, impressed. A crowd is gathering and Ronnie steps up --  26.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: (authoritatively) Stay back, everyone! These are professional lifeguards and I ama life-guard trainee... just found out few minutes ago, in fact... God I am so happy right now!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: aman in his 50s wearing a lifeguard’s dress browns (like uniform) steps out of a tower, observing the action --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: c'mon! COUGH! The guy finally spits water and takes a deep breat Summer smiles to Brody. He did it.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BALLOON
dialogues.text: (with his first breath)

dialogues.speaker: MY CELL PHONE
dialogues.text: CJ rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH SAFELY LANDING THE BALLOON ON THE SAND
dialogues.text: And everyone goes nuts CHEERING! Mitch carries her out of balloon basket, as Stephanie puts her chair on the deck jutting onto the sand. Mitch places her safely back in it

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I live my life by the ancient Chinese proverb: “He who saves a life is responsible for it”. You've been given a second chance, Janie. I want you to promise me you'll make the most of it. Don’t let me down.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN/ JANIE
dialogues.text: I promise. I won’t settle anymore. I deserve better. The balloon guy runs over, wrapped in a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BALLOON
dialogues.text: Janie! Oh thank God you’re OK. I am so sorry! (hugs her awkwardly) Did you happen to see if I dropped my phone in the balloon? She PUNCHES him in the nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch and tower. He 27. Stephanie are walking back toward the lifeguard sees BRODY shaking hands with CAPTAIN THORPE.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What’s this? Co Brody made a good save. He was the first one out there. He’s got the gift, Mitch... Captain Thorpe turns now to Mitch, waving at him --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: Lieutenant! Can I have a word?

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Summer and Ronnie watch as Mitch talks to Captain Thorpe through the window. Summer turns to Brody as he approache

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: So. Guess it looks like you might be joining us after all...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Hey, I didn’t say anything, the Captain came to me. (watching Mitch) God he’s really gonna hate me now.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you’re dead. Mitch finally exits the lifeguard tower, walking down...

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: So give him a reason to like you... And just like that, Mitch is in Brody’s face.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: OK, Mr. Brody, Captain Thorpe says you're in. So I want you here with the others by 0:600 ready to train. And I’1l bet sand-dollars to donuts you quit before the week is out...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: (smiles, enjoying this) Happy to be aboard... Lieutenant.  28.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS, (0S)
dialogues.text: Mitch! OH MITCH?! They turn. Braxton Leeds getting out of a BLACK MERCEDES the adjacent lot. He walks over with a shark’s smile.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Mr. Leeds. What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: The Club’s speedboat back would be nice. Gas ‘er up maybe, before the next parasail lesson -- He laughs but no one shares it. It’s clear all over Mitch face: He does NOT like this guy. BRAXTON LEEDS (CONT’D) Joking, I’m joking. Happy to help. I actually stopped by to tell you we're having a ‘Heal the Bay’ benefit at the Club this weekend. Course that’s just a rich person’s word for Big Party, ain’t it? But I'd like you and your team to be my guests. Free food, free drinks --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You know, lifeguards have a sixth sense about things... (pointedly) And that includes people. I looked into you. You've taken over two other beach-clubs up north. It’s strange. By the time you left, crime in the area was way up... (beat) Mostly drug related.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Don’t have to tell me. It’s a bloody epidemic. Blame the downturn in the economy. So whaddya say? Come help raise money for the Bay!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I’m on duty that night. Hell, I’m never off duty. Leeds smiles knowingly through Mitch’s hard stare. Mitch back to the Tower. Leeds shrugs, ‘suit yourself’ and leav

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Well, the rest of you perhaps!  29. As Leeds goes back to his car, Brody leans to the others

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: We are definitely going to that.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Not sure you’re gonna have much time for a party. You gotta memorize every word of your lifeguard manuals by Friday. Stephanie hands each of them a thick LIFEGUARD MANUAL. It the size of a phonebook. Stephanie gives them a look, lea Summer, Brody and Ronnie share the moment. They made it.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: So... Summer -- you wanna get something to eat? Hit the books?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: I can see through you Brody, and just so you know? I am laser focused on my dream, so no matter how many times you ask me? It’s no. Summer walks away as Brody gets defensive --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got alotta stuff to do, too. Send out some tweets, let my fans know whassup --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Hey, I'll grab a bite with you -- Summer is gone. Brody gives Ronnie a look and they part w

dialogues.speaker: SUNDOWN
dialogues.text: The beach is almost empty. Ronnie gets in his beat up Hon CJ and Stephanie leave together. Summer off on her own. Everyone has a place to go except: BRODY. He watches them He looks over, sees the OLYMPIC BANNER from his signing t morning rolled up in the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: SEA CAVE
dialogues.text: We are inside a sea cave. The water glows from some unsee source. It’s spooky in here, beautiful. Leeds and Frankie with MARCO, waiting on the sand by the water, expectant.

dialogues.speaker: MARCO
dialogues.text: (Mexican accent) I thought we were unloading?  30.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: And I thought your boss would know better than to send me a skimming piece of shit like you -- Marco turns -- what? -- and Leeds has an arm around his n and violently wrestles him into the water. Frankie watche stoic, as Leeds forces Marco’s head under. Marco screams, precious air bubbles escaping his lungs, but still Leeds not let up. But that’s not the worst part. Leeds seems to really be enjoying this...

dialogues.speaker: THE BEACHCOMBER SNACK SHACK
dialogues.text: Summer is focused on the thick LIFEGUARD MANUAL before he Someone shouts behind her, getting her attention. We see the manual is actually on the BAR, and she’s WORKING, wai tables. She must have switched her hours so she can pursu her dream. She delivers a round of drinks over the boiste shouts of drunken tourists... Something out the window gets her attention. Is that... BRODY? It looks like he’s huddled up outside the public restrooms. Her face fills with concern. RONNIE’S PLACE Ronnie is staring at himself in the mirror. His shirt is off. He takes a deep breath, then -- BZ2ZZZ! He brings up electric razor and shuts his eyes. He can do this. He bri it to his nipple-fros, and hair flies.

dialogues.speaker: OUTDOOR RESTROOMS
dialogues.text: Brody has made himself a not-so-comfortable spot by the outdoor restrooms, using his duffel bag as a pillow. Just then, CJ comes to stand over him -- Co What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Huh? Me? You kidding? This view is unbeatable. People pay 5-10k a month don’t get a view like this. Co No lifeguard of Baywatch is gonna sleep outside, even a trainee. Sends a bad message to the public. You're crashing with us.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Us?  31. CJ & STEPHANIE’S PLACE Yep, CJ and Stephanie are roomies. The place is a clash o contrasting styles: CJ the messy free-spirit with her tin outfits and towels hanging everywhere, and Stephanie the organized clean freak. Brody is on the couch, drinking be watching TV. From the other room, we hear arguing.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (OS)
dialogues.text: We don’t even know him! And his motorcycle woke up the whole neighborhood! cad (OS) You're so uptight, it’s just until he gets his first paycheck! Plus, he’s got a good aura!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: (calling to them) And I'm an Aquarius! MITCH’S PLACE A cozy little spot, right on the beach. Not much more tha one-bedroom, but it’s manly and cool. Sparse, clean, beac themed. Mitch is cooking a large gourmet meal. But we soo see it’s dinner for one. As he’s about to put the first b in his mouth, he looks off, as if in deep thought. REVEAL: Mitch is actually looking at HOBO JOE in his open window, licking his lips. Mitch brings him the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie and Leon are in a small boat, dumping FISH GUTS f the same barrels we saw at the club. They’re chumming the water. And that’s when we see that the very dead MARCO, n dressed like a tourist in a loud bathing suit, mask and snorkel awkwardly on his face, lies in the boat’s belly. pick him up, and toss him over the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s 0:600, and as told, Summer and Ronnie stand at atten as Mitch marches around them, carrying a red rescue can.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: The “rescue can” is a lifeguard’s most versatile and essential tool. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It can be used as a flotation device... a signal to other lifeguards... and much, much more. Summer stifles a yawn, exhausted from trying to balance w and her dream. She whispers to CJ when Mitch turns away -

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Where's Brody?? Co He was already gone when I got up.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: No talking! There are over 45 uses for a rescue can. Mitch himself wrote over twenty of them, some approvals still pending. Again, all in your manual... And that’s when Brody saunters over the hill with a tray coffees and a bag of bagels.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Good morning! Sorry I’m late. Oh, cool, is this when we get the red thingies? Awesome. But first -- (handing out coffees) CJ, got yours with extra-sugar because you’re so sweet. Splenda for Stephanie. Mitch, figured you straight black, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: ‘Sorry... I'm late’? CJ shuts her eyes. Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Uh... only by a few --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: 12 minutes. Long enough for little Suzie to drown because you weren’t there to rescue her. Mitch pours out the coffee, right on the ground. He shoot look to the others. They follow his lead and all pour the out too. Summer’s mouth quivers, really wanted that coffe

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: OK, I get it. Won’t happen again. Just trying to do a kind gesture, start off on the right foot.  33.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Can we keep the bagels? Brody's CELL PHONE rings. He looks at the number, and loo to Mitch, whose eyes are growing wider with disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: (answers) Go for Brody! Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Brody covers the phone and shout-whispers to Mitch --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey man, can you do me a solid and float me an advance till my first check? Rental needs first and last. Mitch smiles, nods enthusiastically. Almost overly.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Lemme talk to him. Brody is surprised at the kindness, but gives him the pho Without hesitation, Mitch turns and THROWS IT what seems a mile down the beach. It lands perfectly in a GARBAGE CA

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Me? I don’t carry a cell phone because I keep my head on a swivel. Anyone needs to get a hold of me? They know where to find me. Right here on the beach. And from now on? You? You carry this -- Mitch SHOVES a red rescue can into Brody’s mid-section.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Break into teams. Summer with Stephanie. Ronnie, you’re with CJ. Was that a tiny squeal of excitement we heard from Ronnie

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Starbucks? You’re with me.

dialogues.speaker: THE OCEAN
dialogues.text: Once again, the ocean is glassy until... Mitch emerges li beast. Before he can begin his morning jog, though -- Bro rises out of the water behind him -- winded, covered in seaweed and he’s got three jelly fish stuck to him --  34.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: They're attracted to chlorine! Mitch just smirks and starts running. Brody digs deep for second wind and follows. He’s not about to quit.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE DOING SIT-UPS IN THE SAND
dialogues.text: CJ holds his feet. He’s really tired, really struggling. Co C’mon, Ronnie! I believe in you!

dialogues.speaker: I CAN'T
dialogues.text: He lays flat, giving up. CJ is frustrated, takes off her Baywatch JACKET. Ronnie does a painful sit up to get a be look. CJ pushes his head back down, and he sits up again an awful SCREAM. Over and over they do this. CJ smiles.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE AND SUMMER AT THE SNACK SHACK
dialogues.text: They're sweaty and tired. Sang drops off two-waters to th

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mr. Sang.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SANG
dialogues.text: Sang proud of you! Keep working hard, you make dreams come true! You make great lifeguard like Sang hero Mitch Buchanan! Summer beams as he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: You know Sang came here as a refugee. Mitch helped reunite him with his long lost son.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: That's amazing. Are you sure it’s OK we're taking a break like this?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Part of being a lifeguard is getting to know your team. Especially us girls. And frankly, those other two need a lot more work than you do. You’re a natural!  35.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Wow, thanks. How did you become a lifeguard? Stephanie looks off, lost in memory. And then, as Baywatc flashback music swells, and the focus goes a little fuzzy

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I fell in love. When I was young, there was this wonderful man --

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Wait, you used to date Mitch? Music stops, back into focus. It ain’t the 90s anymore.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: I just figured that’s where the story was going. I didn’t mean to cut you --

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: No, no. It’s fine. Saves me the trouble. Yes, I did. They sit in awkward silence for a moment, just staring of drinking their waters. Tourists pass by on the boardwalk.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But our relationship is strictly professional now. Just friends.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Oh of course, I got that. Again, more silence. A roller-blader skates by. Finally -

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Soooooo... we should probably -- ?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Yep. They get up from the table and head back for the beach.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH AND BRODY IN THE LIFEGUARD TOWER
dialogues.text: Mitch behind Brody, holding Brody's head, slowly moving i back and forth --  36.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Head on a swivel... head on a swivel. Now. Tell me what you see.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: That old woman going in the surf. Could fall over at the first wave.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Go deeper. Swivel.... swivel... Brody sees something -- runs down, grabs a SURF BOARD tha has just washed ashore. Mitch follows him, authoritative.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Surf board, no rider! Possible missing person!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Describe the victim.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Uhhh... Likes... surfing? Mitch takes a two-second cursory glance at the board.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Missing person is a woman. Five feet, four inches tall. Lefty. (off his look) The board is pink, feet set goofy, and 55 centimeters apart, which makes her five four. Brody nods, impressed. Mitch kneels by the board, scrapes little bit of wax off and rubs it between his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some of this sand isn’t from here. It’s volcanic. She’s from Hawaii. 26 years old... Mitch coming at Brody as his eyes bug out in disbelief --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Long brunette hair. Beautiful green eyes...

dialogues.speaker: GIRL'S VOICE, (0S)
dialogues.text: My board!  37. An amazingly sexy surfer girl who matches Mitch’s descrip exactly comes over, and gives Mitch a kiss on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Got away from you in the rip, huh, Ang? Keep tellin’ ya, wear the leash, girl.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE SURFER
dialogues.text: Keep tellin’ you, come back to Hawaii with me. Get married. Have lots of kids. Mitch smiles warmly. Brody just shakes his head. She grins,

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That sounds like a little slice of heaven. But I’m married to the Bay.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE SURFER
dialogues.text: But you still gonna watch my niece for me next Thursday?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Lookin’ forward to it. takes the board, and goes off into the surf.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: That was lame. And lemme guess -- you saved her life once and now you're responsible for it?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Code I live by.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: She was hot! You should be nailing that instead of doin’ favors for her. You saved her life! She owes you! Beej, at least...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: And let me guess -- your idea of romance is Snapchatting a dick pic.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Sometimes! Good icebreaker...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Love is as deep and mysterious and as powerful as the ocean. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And when you find that one in a million -- you jump in with both feet, with love and respect, not Beejes and Dick Pics. Mitch’s two-way squawks to life, cutting him off --

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (OVER COM)
dialogues.text: Mitch -- We got a One-Three-Seven, water by Tower Two, Confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (INTO COM)
dialogues.text: On my way. Mitch starts running toward the yellow rescue truck --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Wait, what’s a 137?!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Manual! You should know! Brody grabs the thick manual, and starts flips through. A a moment, he tosses it aside and runs after Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: A DEAD BODY, (MARCO)
dialogues.text: Washed up on shore, eyes still open. A small crab walks across its lifeless face. Mitch, Stephanie and Brody star Loud bathing suit. One CONVERSE SNEAKER on, one missing.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: What do you think, Mitch? Dead 24, maybe 48 hours? Mitch smells him.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Are you serious? You’re smelling him?!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Lifeguard uses all his senses. Brody tries to accept this. Can’t.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Never seen a dead body before.  39.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What, nobody ever died on the slip- n-slide? Keep it together and get this down: Victim is male. Approximately 35 years of age. As Mitch talks, Brody looks around -- doesn’t have a pen, paper. Mitch rolls the body to one side.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shark bite on the lower right torso. Don’t think that’s the cause of death, though... (looks at the hand) Fingernails are blue. Suggests -- You gettin’ this??

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: You threw my phone away, that’s how I normally take notes! Something stops Mitch. He leans down and sees something sticking out of the back of the bathing suit. A SALES TAG

dialogues.speaker: ELLERBEE, (0S)
dialogues.text: GET AWAY FROM THERE! Right now! Do NOT touch him! They turn and see Ellerbee coming over the dune.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Oh come on, Sergeant. Don’t give me any of that jurisdiction crap.

dialogues.speaker: ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: Mitch, for the last time: you do not HAVE a jurisdiction. You are not a police officer. You’re not detectives. You are lifeguards. Your job is to make sure white people are doing okay at swimming.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: This happened on my beach.

dialogues.speaker: ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: Yes, and apparently, because you weren’t doing your job good enough, some tourist is dead. So now, this is a matter for the police. You see the difference? Ellerbee taps his badge with his baton, then taps the pat on their swimsuits -- Badge, patch:  40.

dialogues.speaker: ELLERBEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Badge, on a uniform. Patch, on a swimsuit. Badge on a uniform, patch on a swimsuit... Behind them, an ambulance pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Just make sure you keep Baywatch HQ looped in on the investigation.

dialogues.speaker: ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: HQ? You mean where you guys eat lunch? You know, I would love to, Mitch? But the Police Department has a strict policy: No Shoes, No Shirt, No Service. Ellerbee moves off with a smug smile. Mitch calls to him:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: It’s supposed to be a ‘Thin’ Blue Line, Ellerbee! Thin! I can help you get there! (aside to Brody) Congrats, pool boy. Looks like you're on a big case. First god damn week of summer...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: We have cases?!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: There was a tag on his shorts. It was from the Huntley Club...

dialogues.speaker: AND AS WE PULL AWAY
dialogues.text: We see that Braxton Leeds is in the far distance, watchin the scene through BINOCULARS, Frankie and Leon behind him

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Golly, Mitch. Maybe you aren’t the best lifeguard on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Still think I shoulda left the body in his tub. Straight frame job.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: They'd never buy it. Trust me, this is the first step to a very hard fall for Mr. Buchanan. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now. We’ve got a party to prepare for so we can get those nosy bastards off my beach... EXT. BAYWATCH ‘HEADQUARTERS’ - LATE AFTERNOON ‘Headquarters’ is really not much more than Mitch’s offic couple desks, lunch room, locker room, and showers. On th wall are weather reports, and PHOTOS of the people that M has saved. Looks like the wall of a Hollywood dry-cleaner Ronnie walks in, covered head-to-toe in sand. Heads for t

dialogues.speaker: LIFEGUARD SHOWERS
dialogues.text: PSSSH! Ronnie moans, body aching as he showers. We are watching him from the waist-up. Two random male lifeguard come in, talking. Ronnie a little self-conscious, doesn’t make eye-contact, but rolls with it. He’s one of them, ri

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Riptide strong enough for ya?! They laugh with him. Just then, CJ is right behind him -- Co Hey, Ronnie!

dialogues.speaker: CJ
dialogues.text: Co Co-ed showers. All part of the same team. I’m takin’ lunch orders, we got some time between shifts.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: UHHH -- just a salad! Co You sure? This place has great cheese-steak subs.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: NO, NO, not for me. Co OK. By the way, when we shower in here? We keep our suits on. And now, from behind, we reveal that Ronnie is naked and everyone else is still in their swimwear.  She gives teammate, cover his 42.

dialogues.speaker: CJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clean nips are lookin’ really good, by the way! him a friendly smack on his bare ass like a and leaves. Ronnie turns, desperately trying to privates, reaching for a towel --

dialogues.speaker: LUNCH ROOM
dialogues.text: Stephanie, Brody, Summer, and Ronnie are eating in the lu room. But while everyone else eats greasy, shitty food, Ronnie, hair still wet, is poking at a salad. Mitch isn’t eating, eyes on the water out the window --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: I don’t understand what you’re getting bent outta shape about. A shark got that guy. Or he drowned.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Am I the only one who got a salad?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: People die, doesn’t mean something sinister is going on. And you heard Ellerbee. Even if there was, that’s not our job anyway!

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I thought you had to be on, like, a really restrictive diet to look like you guys. CJ looks at Ronnie, confused, takes a sip of soda.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: I mean, we're lifeguards, right? We help people not get sunburned, and yes, very occasionally make sure people don’t drown, but beyond that -- what you’re talking about sounds like an albeit very entertaining, but far-fetched TV show! Mitch turns on him, almost fierce --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That’s what you think, huh? So tell me. What are you gonna do if there’s a giant squid in the cove??

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: I’1l1 call animal control.  43.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Sand-grifters running a con on the beach??

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Sand-grifters? Sand-grifters?!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: How about diamond smugglers moving the rocks in surfboards?!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What?! I’d call the cops.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Ellerbee?? Ha! I told you. Baywatch is about going above and beyond. The fingernails on that body were blue. That guy had the bends. You know what that means?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Decompression sickness?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Very good. Somebody's been studying their manual. Now why would a guy who drowned, or was bit by a shark, have the bends?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: You said the tag was from the Huntley Club? Maybe CJ and I should go to that party. Look around, see if anyone knew him... Mitch nods.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I just gotta ask, no judgements -- (beat) Are you guys all on steroids? (off their head shakes) Bulimic...? Suddenly a shaky woman’s VOICE comes over the emergency c WOMAN’S VOICE (OVER COM) MAY-DAY, MAY-DAY, I'm not sure I'm using this radio right, and I need help... can anyone hear me...? Stephanie is on it, grabs the com --

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: This is Baywatch, what is your position? Over.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (OVER COM)
dialogues.text: I'm not quite sure... my friend went diving over an hour ago. I'm here on the boat all alone... and I think I smell smoke...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Can you read the coordinates on your GPS? Over.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (OVER COM)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I can't -- I'm blind. But I know we started from Pier 13 and went West... Over. Mitch is moving for the door, Brody on his heels --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Call the Coast Guard, tell ‘em she’s blind out there, no location tracking. I’1l take the Waverunner, you get in the Scarab, we’ll track her on our radar -- GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a very beautiful and very nervous woman (VICTORI on the other end of the com --

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (OVER COM)
dialogues.text: Hold your position, we're on our way! Over.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Uhh... OK. I won’t be able to see you coming, but I’1l be here, waving my arms... Over. And as she turns with a blank stare, we realize -- Ohh... this woman is actually blind blind. She reaches out awkwardly, unsure of her surroundings, feeling her way. There’s smoke and sparks coming from the engines!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SHORE
dialogues.text: Mitch jumps on a Baywatch WAVERUNNER, Brody just behind h

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Where’s mine?!  45.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Only one, let’s move! Mitch turns the key and fires the engine --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: There’s only one seat!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Now or never, Wet-N-Wild! Brody swallows his pride and gets on. It’s more than a li awkward. He holds onto the side of the craft as VOOOOOMMM Mitch guns it and Brody barely keeps his balance --

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE FISHING BOAT
dialogues.text: As Victoria moves in the boat, she catches her foot ina fishing pole mount, tripping -- and KNOCKS OVER a large r container of GASOLINE. We follow the spilled gas as it gu out the hole meant to drain excess water -- -- and into the water surrounding the boat. The slick spreads, all the way toward the sparking engines --

dialogues.speaker: THE WAVERUNNER
dialogues.text: Brody is having trouble hanging on, about to fall off --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lock your arms around my waist! Brody begrudgingly obeys... and holds onto Mitch tight. T BOUNCE in the waves, Brody really getting jostled, his FA mashing and wiping against Mitch’s greasy back --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: How many buckets of lotion do you go through a day?! You’re like a greasy hairless gorilla!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Then you better hold on Chim-Chim ‘cuz that’s smoke on the horizon! In the distance, there is indeed a new plume of DARK SMOK Mitch takes a SHARP LEFT TURN and Brody starts to fall of But his momentum swings him around Mitch’s slick body and Brody ends up in Mitch’s lap, facing the wrong way!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Abhhh!! They stare at each other awkwardly for half a second befo  46.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You want Pop-Pop to tell you a story?!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Just hold on, baby-boy -- Mitch guns it as fast as it’ll go and Brody is forced to his face in Mitch’s chest --

dialogues.speaker: THE FISHING BOAT
dialogues.text: There is now a RING OF FIRE around the boat. Victoria is waving her arms, and as the sound of the WAVERUNNER approaches, she changes direction toward it.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Is that you?! HELP!! I’m over here!

dialogues.speaker: THE SPEEDING WAVERUNNER
dialogues.text: Mitch guns the Waverunner as fast as it can go, heading t straight for the fiery conflagration in the near distance

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Take the wheel! Radio Stephanie in Rescue 1 with our position! HARD

dialogues.speaker: LEFT WHEN I TELL YOU --
dialogues.text: Brody awkwardly takes the wheel as Mitch actually STANDS as they’re still speeding -- right toward the boat --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What I swore an oath to do -- (voice of a god)

dialogues.speaker: HIT IT
dialogues.text: Brody YANKS the handlebars LEFT as Mitch DIVES -- his spe and momentum launching him like a rocket made of Mitch Fucking Buchanan -- rope strapped around his arm, red res can flying behind him -- SPLOOSH! Perfect dive into the w just in front of the flames!

dialogues.speaker: MONEY SHOT
dialogues.text: Mitch doing a powerful breast-stroke, churning the sea as above him, we see the surface of the water is covered in glowing fire! Oh yeah, this is going in the trailer.  47.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FISHING BOAT
dialogues.text: Victoria is panicking, doesn’t know which direction to lo as Mitch climbs up the side of the boat --

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Right here! Is there a fire extinguisher on board?!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I don’t know!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Just stay calm, I’m gonna get you out of this -- you see that rescue boat on the horizon?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: No -- I can’t see!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: It’s the smoke, shut your eyes, it’‘ll pass -- She instinctively takes his hand. Even in the action, Mit does a double-take with this woman. She’s beautiful --

dialogues.speaker: BAYWATCH RESCUE BOAT
dialogues.text: Stephanie is at the wheel of the sleek yellow scarab --

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: There they are!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FISHING BOAT
dialogues.text: Mitch looks over the side of the boat. The flames are HIG NOW, and closer. Just then, RESCUE ONE arrives --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No way we can jump, the flames are too high --

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I can’t swim either! Oh coming out here was the worst idea! She grabs his hand tighter, trying to get safe --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: It’s OK -- I won’t let you go --  48.

dialogues.speaker: ON RESCUE ONE
dialogues.text: Brody is climbing up the side of the scarab, having swum from the waverunner. Stephanie’s eyes are locked on Mitch is making a series of complex SIGNALS with his rescue can

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus, Mitch is callin’ for a Salty Turnover --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?!

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: He wants to capsize the boat. (off Brody’s look) Page 29 of the manual. You really need to start studying! CJ hands Summer and Brody each a line of nautical rope attached to the back of the scarab --

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Go! Summer and Brody DIVE into the water with the rope --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: OK, we're about to do a tricky maneuver. Remember the scene in Titanic when they --

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I've never seen it!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Really? You've never seen Titanic? Very popular movie.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I don’t go to a lot of movies -- as I said, I can’t --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: It’s OK -- just when I say so, hold onto this rail real tight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer and Brody are swimming UNDERNEATH the boat with th rope, looking to tie them off to two loops on the other s just under the water line.  49. But then -- something catches Brody’s eye -- something HU in the distance. A long dark unmistakable silhouette -- A SHARK. Bubbles erupt from Brody’s mouth -- he’s freakin out -- and drops the rope! He swims back toward the Scara Summer finishes her job, and affixes her end --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FISHING BOAT
dialogues.text: The flames climb higher, onto the boat itself. They aren’ gonna last much longer, this thing is going to explode.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (yelling to Rescue 1) How we doin’?! Brody is climbing onto the scarab just as Summer emerges

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: We only got one side!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: I -- I dropped the rope! I’m sorry! Stephanie doesn’t hesitate and DIVES IN --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer watches Stephanie grab the floating rope, and tie to the other underwater fixture on the other side of the boat. Once it’s secure, she gives Summer a ‘thumbs up’ an

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: It’s secure! CJ guns the boat and the ropes go taught. The boat starts slowly tip! She pushes the engines harder -- and the fish boat starts to --

dialogues.speaker: DEEP BREATH
dialogues.text: -- CAPSIZE! As the boat flips, the flames are extinguishe

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RESCUE BOAT
dialogues.text: Every eye is on the water. Mitch and Victoria are nowhere be seen. The wait seems like an eternity. Brody is especi sweating this, knows he fucked up big time --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: C’mon, Mitch... please... c’mon.  50. And then, like the sea is giving birth, Mitch breaks thro the surface, the unconscious Victoria in his arms --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOAT
dialogues.text: Mitch carefully lays her flat, and begins administering C There’s something almost sensual when Mitch does it, bein gentle on her frame as he breathes life into her --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Come back to me... you can do it... More breath... more pushes on her chest... all eyes on he And then, she coughs up water and opens her eyes. Mitch smiles, captivated by her. Instant electricity. She reach out, and touches his face and chest -- trying to get a picture of what he looks like.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: (aside, to Summer) Jeez, get a room, lady. He smiles, trying to be funny. Summer shoves him -- shut She and CJ enjoying watching their moment.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You... saved me... You saved my life. Her hand comes to his cheek. Her stare looks just past hi And then, Mitch understands. He understands everything...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You're... blind.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Yes. I was born without sight. But right now... I feel like I can see everything. Mitch stares at Victoria with a look we haven’t seen befo Summer turns to CJ and they share an -- awwww! -- look.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I’m... Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Victoria. And then, the world melts away, and we go into a DREAM SEQUENCE, all set to Peter Gabriel’s ‘In Your Eyes’. No, no... wait! Even better: Lionel Richie’s cheesy and haunt classic ‘Say You, Say Me’ --  51.

dialogues.speaker: BEGIN DREAM SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: And as Lionel croons over the synth keyboard:

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL RICHIE
dialogues.text: ‘,.-I had a dream, I had an awesome dream...’ In a field of wild-flowers, Mitch and Victoria run at eac other -- she falls, disappearing for a second -- then pop up, now running in the completely wrong direction. Mitch happily chases her, catches up to her, and they embrace - Mitch and Victoria are now slow dancing on the beach, Mit in a white linen suit, no shoes -- and as they spin, he’s in a tux (still no shoes) Victoria in a wedding dress. Th are surrounded by lifeguards clapping at their beach wedd Music builds -- drums kick in -- Victoria is now in the shallow ocean, wearing red-arm floaties (?) her face in pain (??) and we see now she’s giving birth (!!) A proud Mitch receives the beautiful ba boy and holds him over his head like the Lion King as all manner of sea-life surface, splashing and celebrating -- LIONEL RICHIE (CONT’D) ‘,..And as we go down, life's lonesome highway...’ Mitch (now with a thick moustache) and Victoria are holdi hands in the audience of a school play, proudly watching their child dressed as a starfish, dancing. As everyone claps, Victoria’s head is just askew, and Mitch gently re corrects it toward the stage by her chin. Cymbals crash -- and it gets funky -- We're deep in the future now. Mitch has fuzzy grey hair o his head and a goatee, wearing weird futuristic clothes. adult son stands next to him, a dead ringer for the old m They watch as Victoria undergoes space-age laser eye surg As they take off the eye-bandages, Mitch watching wide-ey grinning, tears streaming -- she can see! She leans in an hugs the young doctor. He corrects her -- no, no, this is your husband -- they all laugh. Victoria and Mitch kiss. And now, Lionel takes us home -- LIONEL RICHIE (CONT’D) ‘,..Say you, Say me. Say it for always...’ They're so old now. Mitch has a long grey beard, skin age  52. But they’re still together, happy, surrounded by children grandchildren. They look into each other’s eyes sweetly. And as the song plays its final haunting melody -- Victoria stands in a cemetery. The headstone says: Mitch Buchanan -- Father, Lover, Protector of the Bay. She puts red rescue can down respectfully on the recently dug eart when -- Mitch's FIST breaks through the soil and grabs it

dialogues.speaker: END DREAM SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: It all happened in an instant, Mitch still staring into Victoria's beautiful blind eyes --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (repeating it back) Victoria... And as RESCUE ONE speeds away, a DIVER finally emerges fr the depths, holding a starfish. He looks around, sees his burnt upside-down boat. He just stares and stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie stands on the tower, binoculars to her eyes. Co Uhh... Stephanie? The people we're watching are that way.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Look at them. They’ve been like that for over two hours! He’s spent time with her every day this week! CJ takes the binoculars and looks. In the distance, we se Mitch and Victoria sitting together on the rocks, talking effortlessly with one another.
