dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why is he falling for her so hard? He could be with anyone! Co All these women who throw themselves at Mitch. He knows they only want him for what’s on the outside. But with her, Mitch knows she’s judging him by what’s on the inside. I think it’s romantic. They’re so perfect for each other!  53. Stephanie takes back the binoculars from CJ to look again

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: He just met her! Mitch doesn’t know anything about her! And he’s spending less and less time on the beach... Co Maybe he knows... that she needs saving. And that’s all that matters. Don’t be jealous, Steph. Be happy Mitch found someone again.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I’m not jealous, CJ. I just... don’t want him to get hurt. (petty) And that sweater she’s wearing. You’d have to be blind to wear that...

dialogues.speaker: ON MITCH AND VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Mitch and Victoria sit on the rocks overlooking the ocean the sun sinks into the sea, painting the sky with one of most incredible sunsets we've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: God I wish you could see this sunset.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Describe it to me. How the hell can you do that?!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: OK. Lessee here. Ummm... there’s a terrific amount of orange...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: What does ‘orange’ look like?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Well... do you know what an orange looks like?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Uhhhhh no. But I know how it feels. How it tastes...  54.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: It’s like that. But through your eyes. With tart purple plums, and sweet pink cotton candy. All mixed together...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Sounds... wonderful. Mitch turns to her, really looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: So you probably don’t know how beautiful you are either. She playfully pushes him, and he hugs her tighter.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Oh, Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You know, there’s an old saying among lifeguards. If you kiss when the sun sets, you stay in love forever... Victoria turns to him, really looking at him (as much as can). She pulls his face close.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Let’s find out if it’s true... And she pulls him close for a perfect kiss as the sun sli into the sea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The banner says ‘HEAL THE BAY’. The party is Luau themed. the beach outside the club, large shirtless men spin flam sticks, beautiful hula dancers swing their hips to drums, huge pig roasts on a spit. Summer and Brody are the first the lifeguards to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Wow, you look great, Summer. She does look lovely in a yellow sun-dress.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Thanks -- but don’t get any ideas. This isn’t a date. Not to mention, Mitch said it’s against the rules...  55.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Of course. Work event. And normally I don’t bring a buddy on a date -- And now we see Ronnie is trailing just behind them.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Wow! I’ve never been to Hawaii! All the foreign countries I’ve been to have been in Vegas...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HUNTLEY CLUB
dialogues.text: Inside is a scene, man. At the center of a long table fil with exotic treats from the sea, there is an enormous ICE SCULPTURE of what looks like POSEIDON. Here comes Leeds:

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Here they are, Mitch’s new team! So glad you could come. Lemme get you some drinks.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Thanks for having us, this is amazing!

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: No Mitch? Was hoping he’d change his mind...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: This isn’t Mitch’s scene. Too many people havin’ fun, nobody to save.

dialogues.speaker: SEA CAVE
dialogues.text: In the same sea cave where Leeds killed Marco, Mitch is holding Victoria’s body up as she floats on her back. He’ getting her comfortable in the water.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Relax... breathe normally... Good. I’ve got you. Just remember: panicking... over-exertion... those are the things that take us under. But if you just let yourself go... Mitch gradually removes his hands, lets her float on her

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You're still holding me, right?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No, you're doing it all yourse--  56. But SHE PANICS AND LUNGES INTO HIS ARMS.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Sorry... I just...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: It’s okay. We’ll take it slow. She licks her lips, feels safe in his arms. It’s intimate

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: How is the water so warm in here?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: The Tongva Native Americans -- who originally settled here -- believe the warmth comes from the spirit of the Pacific Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Something tells me... you’ve said that one before. Have you brought other women here...?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I’m not going to lie to you, Victoria. She waits for him to finish... but, doesn’t. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Mitch Buchanan... They kiss. She takes off her top as they sink deeper into water. She jolts a bit when she feels his... er, passion. VICTORIA (CONT’D) My goodness... is that --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Spirit of the ocean. .+-and they resume the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTLEY CLUB
dialogues.text: CJ and STEPHANIE arrive and take in the luau theme. Steph is dressed conservatively, almost business attire, and CJ wearing a sexy revealing authentic Hawaiian outfit. Co I don’t understand why you didn’t dress up like me. Mitch said we should blend in and snoop around.  57.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Uhhh I can’t dress like you do, CJ. Co Why not? Just then, Leeds sees CJ’s insane outfit and squeezes his wine glass so hard it shatters. CJ sees Ronnie, waves to

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Just trust me.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS OUTDOOR DECK
dialogues.text: Brody and Summer stand on the deck, overlooking the ocean

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: So you were rooting for me in Beijing!

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: I was rooting for America...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Admit it, you had a T-Shirt with my face on it...

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Yeah, but afterwards, my Dad used it to wash his car. They laugh. Brody chugs some of his beer.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So... I always wondered. What happened? The night before the relay... Brody shakes his head, doesn’t know if he wants to answer

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I just... had to get out of there. Got drunk... wound up at the zoo... tried to let a Panda out of his pen... (tries to laugh it off) I don’t wanna talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: OK. You wanna talk about why you dropped the rope the other day? Brody looks off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you are relentless. OK. I thought I -- saw something. A shark. A giant shark...

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Wow. Well that would scare anybody.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: No, it was more than that. I completely freaked out. I felt like I was gonna die. It was the most scared I've ever been in my life.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: More scared than you were the night before the relay race? Brody locks eyes with her. Summer is wise.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What kind of lifeguard is afraid of sharks? Maybe I am a pool boy...

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Don’t say that. You just gotta... face your fears. Don’t try to deal with it all on your own. Be a part of the team. Tell Mitch what happened, maybe he can --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? He’s the last guy I would tell... he’d just take a giant shit on me again. So sick of that guy. He acts like he owns me. (finishes his beer) I swear I’m gonna hock a loogie in his suntan lotion...

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Maybe you should lay off the beer.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: You know what? You’re right. Summer smiles. She’s a good influence on him.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s open bar, I should be drinking tequila --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is making a large plate of seafood -- CJ talking w him as they move down the long buffet table -- Co Absolutely I can see your aura. Your's is white hot. Right around this area -- She waves her hand right around his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Never gonna live that down am I? Co No, but your aura does tell me you need to be less guarded. Don’t be afraid of what people think -- show ‘em what’s inside you!

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Well that’s easy for you, you’re such a free spirit -- He grabs another handful of shrimp just as Leeds appears

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Atta boy, mate! Don’t hold back, it’s all you can eat!

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: No, no -- this is for both of --

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: How are you liking the party, CJ? Co Fantastic. How about you give me the grand tour? And do you have a gift shop? My friend Stephanie needs a new suit --

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Of course! Right this way -- Leeds winks to Ronnie and smoothly moves CJ away. Brody c to Ronnie’s side, holding a big glass of tequila.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Love that guy! Hey, you see any ice around here? Gonna get a little Margarita action goin’ --  60. His angry eyes never leaving Leeds whispering in CJ's ear Ronnie reaches over to the ice sculpture’s groin -- PLINK breaks off the ice dick, and drops it into Brody's drink.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: SEA CAVE
dialogues.text: Mitch and Victoria sit against the cave wall, post-coital She's traces tiny circles on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Do you hear that? Like a drumming?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You can hear my heart-beat? Amazing. It’s like you have super --

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: No, down on the beach. Like a tribal beat...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: There’s a party tonight at the Huntley Club. Those drums are the (perfectly pronounced) Hula Pahu.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Oh, wow... that sounds... exotic! I’ve never been anywhere. I’d love to travel the world with you... after you retire, of course.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Haha -- well, I’11 retire when I die, so I might not be much of a traveling companion...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You're so funny, Mitch. We’re not sure he was kidding. Mitch looks over, notices something, washed up against the side of the rocks: It’s a BLACK CONVERSE SHOE. Mitch grabs it, looks at it closely... smells it. VICTORIA (CONT’D) What is it? Did I say something wrong?  61.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (wheels turning) You know, if you wanna hear those drums up close, I did get an invitation... She grins, kisses him again. And as they slip out of the water, Mitch takes the shoe with him...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BEACH
dialogues.text: Mitch and Victoria walk down the beach together under the moonlight toward the Huntley Club in the distance... After a moment, two men in DARK CLOTHING dart over the du toward the sea cave rocks, carrying empty duffel bags...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE SEA CAVE
dialogues.text: A dark DARK SILHOUETTE enters the cave. These are CLOSE SHOTS. We don’t see everything. It’s a mystery what’s happening. Something dark surfaces... Hands move BRICKS OF DRUGS into the duffel bags...

dialogues.speaker: THE HUNTLEY CLUB
dialogues.text: Leeds is showing Stephanie to the gift shop. CJ slips off

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Go ahead, take any suit you like, on the house! Stephanie smiles as Leeds leaves. And once she’s alone, s stops perusing suits -- and starts rifling through drawer behind the register, hunting through receipts.

dialogues.speaker: THE HUNTLEY CLUB
dialogues.text: CJ is moving upstairs, but Leeds now gently takes her arm BRAXTON LEEDS (CONT’D) Sorry, no one allowed upstairs, that’s just the employee offices -- Ronnie looking frustrated as CJ talks with Leeds. He goes the HAWAIIAN BAND, whispering in the singer’s ear -- and that’s when the Hawaiian band kicks into an amazing Islan version of ‘You Should be Dancing’ by the Bee Gees. CJ turns, curious -- sees Ronnie moving people off the main floor, giving himself room to operate. Leeds looks amused What the hell does this guy think he’s --  62. And then it happens. Ronnie breaks into a series of DANCE MOVES right out of Saturday Night Fever. The rubbery arms the kicks, the spins. He is a fucking dancing dynamo. Co WOW! Go Ronnie! Brody and Summer exchange a look -- holy shit! Ronnie tur does the ‘invisible lasso’ to CJ -- ‘pulling her’ away fr Leeds. She goes with it, bounces happily to the dance flo moving closely with Ronnie now, her sexy curves on displa Ronnie’s hand smoothly on her waist --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: You wanted to see what’s inside me? Well this is it -- a fever! Co I love it! You’re amazing!

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Thanks! I was raised by my Grandmother! She forced me to take dance lessons with her! Ronnie breaks into a perfect 70s split. Everyone goes cra Co Wow! What other dances can you do?!

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Nothing! Only disco! She was a strange lady. A strange lady who loved John Travolta’s tight pants.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Mitch and Victoria arrive. Mitch now in his ‘dress browns dressier lifeguard uniform) but still without shoes.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Mitch! Glad you and ya lady could make it. Can I offer you anything? Some socks, perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I don’t let anything come between me and this beach.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: But... we’re inside.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Club’s still on the beach.  63. They both laugh, but there’s lots of friction.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Can I interest you in the seafood buffet?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Looks appetizing. Real quality fish. But you know, it’s funny. I saw a truck from Al’s Fish Company here the other morning... (pointedly) Very low quality. Fishermen hire him, mostly. Al’s the best chum guy around. Did you know he did a little time...? Braxton Leeds’ face grows cold.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: That right? Well, first -- I don’t know this ‘Al’. Second, I’m not sure how much you know about the restaurant game, mate -- but for our very popular fish dip? We don’t use top shelf. Hell of a markup. I make a fortune on the stuff. Promise not to tell, OK, sport? Leeds gives Mitch a wink and a little SLAP on the shoulde As if ‘friendly’ but the message is clear. BRAXTON LEEDS (CONT’D) Enjoy the party -- (to Victoria) Ma’am. Victoria puts her hand out thinking he wants to shake it, he’s already gone. Mitch smoothly lowers her arm for her.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Mitch, what was that all about? I can sense the tension all over you. Mitch makes eye-contact with Stephanie and brings her ove

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Honey, you remember Stephanie. Will you ladies excuse me for a moment? After Mitch leaves, Stephanie and Victoria stand awkwardl

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: So. Blind, huh?  64.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Mitch wanders in, as if lost. The walk-in refrigerator is just ajar. Mitch sticks his head in, and sees rows and ro of dark plastic barrels --

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: You lost? Party’s this way, guy.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY ROOM
dialogues.text: Braxton Leeds sips scotch in a high-tech secure room, watching everyone on video monitors. Most everyone is out watching the hula fire show. Stephanie is sitting (awkwar with Victoria by the pool. CJ huddled closely with Ronnie Leeds watches now as MITCH moves outside by the pool and pulls BRODY aside. Shows him something that was hidden in back of his pants. Leeds squints. What the hell is that? the camera zoom in. It’s Marco’s BLACK CONVERSE.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE, WITH MITCH AND BRODY
dialogues.text: Brody holds the shoe Mitch just gave him incredulously --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Who brings a shoe to a luau?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Remember our friend who washed up on the beach? Found his other shoe in the sea cave. It didn’t wash up there, tides don’t go directly in. That's why the water is so warm. So what was he doing in there...? What if he was killed in there?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Do you know how many shoes end up on the beach? Even Converse?!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Not just any Converse. Look closer. The shoddy stitch-work? They were both knock-offs. You see right there? It says: ‘Convers-o.’ The label does indeed say ‘Converso’ not Converse.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This guy wasn’t local. Plus he buys a 75 dollar swimsuit from here then wears kicks like these? I don’t buy it. This was staged...  65.

dialogues.speaker: ON LEEDS WATCHING THE SCENE ON VIDEO
dialogues.text: Leeds is in Leon’s face. Leon looks terrified.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Did you... or did you not... take off his bloody shoes when you threw Marco in the water -- Leon looks off, as if thinking. Leeds pulls out a glock 9 starts taping Leon’s forehead with the barrel. BRAXTON LEEDS (CONT’D) Think now. Think-think-think-

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I'm... really not sure. Frankie was in charge of changing his clothes -- Leeds shuts his eyes, lowers the gun. Leon exhales.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Converso? Converso?? You really are insane, aren’t you? (a little too loud) Why don’t you loosen up, this is s’posed to be a party!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: OK, no more booze, Drunko. Go home and sleep it off, we got an early start tomorrow --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Uhhh -- you’re not my Dad, Curly, he left when I was four. You're just a lifeguard -- same as me. In fact, Captain Thorpe said I was the future of Baywatch. Those were his exact words!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You finished, pool boy?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: NO! You still owe me $26.50 for four coffees and a half-dozen bagels! Oh, and a new fucking phone. You know my Mom’s been trying to call me for five days?? Yeah -- my GamGam died, I didn’t even know! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had to call her back from a fucking payphone that smelled like Hobo Joe's asshole! I missed her funeral!

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: GamGam...? A CROWD is beginning to gather. Summer goes to Brody, tri to take his hand, trying to diffuse this --

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: C’mon, Brody --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Get offa me! And all your little stupid life lessons?! You’re like a... a... stupid Yoda who’s been exposed to too many gamma rays!

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: (to CJ) Oooh, that was a good one.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: OK, pal. Just tryin’ to help you --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What do you care? You haven’t saved my life yet, so you aren't responsible for it. Yeahhh the famous Mitch Code! Chinese Fuckin’ Proverb! Only... I looked that shit up on the internet. That’s not even a real thing! You know where that came from?! Some stupid TV show from the 70s called Kung Fu! People whispering now -- Mitch noticing. Is he a little rattled by this revelation? He holds his ground --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: My father used to watch that show. Big David Carradine fan. You can find wisdom anywhere...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: That dude wasn’t even Chinese! You know how offensive that is to my generation?! Everyone is staring at Mitch -- he’s starting to feel a little exposed -- he’s human too, this affects him --  67.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Everything is offensive to your generation! Now you've made your point, stand down --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Stand down?! STAND DOWN?! Aye-Aye Captain Swim Trunks! Brody does a drunken sloppy salute, marching around stiff A few people in the crowd laugh --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're just a lifeguard, Mitch! That’s it! You’re not a Navy Seal, you're not a detective, you’re an LA County lifeguard who --

dialogues.speaker: -- WHO I LOVE.
dialogues.text: Brody stops short, sweaty, hammered. Everyone turns, sees Victoria staring (on target this time). Proud, defiant. Brody a bit embarrassed and ashamed, and that’s when he doubles over, sick -- and VOMITS in the pool. Ronnie grimaces. And then, something new ripples through the cro

dialogues.speaker: CLUB MEMBER
dialogues.text: That’s him -- from the Olympics!

dialogues.speaker: CLUB MEMBER
dialogues.text: The Vomit Comet! Brody shuts his eyes, reliving his worst nightmare. Summe goes to him again, puts a caring hand on his back.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: C’mon, Brody. Let me walk you home.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Why?! We can't even date because of Mitch's stupid rules! And I don't have a home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and runs toward the ocean. But we can see it all over Summer's face. She doesn’t hate him. In fact, she’s start to like him. Mitch starts to go after him, but Victoria t his hand. Mitch can only watch him go.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (faintly in the distance) ..-gaaaammm-gaaaammm...!  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sand sculpture artist is busy working on another masterpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passed out, empty tequila bottle still gripped in his han

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Mornin’ sunshine. Brody's eyes flutter open to see Mitch. And we see now th the artist is incorporating Brody into an incredible SAND SCULPTURE in which, from the upper torso down, Brody is a MERMAID. Huge naked breasts, long fish tail, the whole de It’s amazing. Brody doesn’t realize it yet.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: How'd you find me?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Followed the smell of tequila. Brody smacks his lips, squinting in the morning light.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Why -- why are you here -- ?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Because I know what’s inside you.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: (scoffs, dismissive) How would you know what’s inside me?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: ‘Cuz I looked into you. Oh yeah. I know everything about you. Why do you think your slowest time was always the relay, huh? You’re afraid to be part of something, something larger than yourself. A team. But I can help you.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: I’m not afraid of anything...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Then show me. And now, for the first time, Brody notices the sand artis  69.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What’s he doing?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Here, got you something. Mitch reaches into a bag and pulls out a NEW CELL PHONE. Brody manages a smile.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: ..-thanks, man. Mitch points the phone at Brody for a picture:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Say ‘Blow Hole!’

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Wha -- ? REVEAL: There is more to the sand sculpture. There is a DOLPHIN next to Mermaid-Brody, aiming a giant hard-on tow his mouth. CLICK!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That’s goin’ on your Instagram. (beat) C'mon -- takin’ a little field trip. Time for you to join the team...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A three story hospital two-blocks from the ocean. Parked across the street, Mitch and Brody are in the RESCUE TRUC

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What are we doin’ here? You gonna finally get that head of your’s examined?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Close... Mitch opens up the FIRST AID KIT and starts wrapping Brod head in gauze, like he’s got a head wound.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You don’t gotta do a thing. Just look pretty for all the nurses.  70.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Mitch pushes Brody into the hospital in a wheelchair --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: S'cuse me? Found this guy at the beach. Thinks he’s Justin Bieber. Brody tries to hide his rage, then starts mumble-singing Justin Bieber songs. (No we don’t know what they are eith

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Oh you poor thing. Did you fall? As they speak, Mitch slips behind the nurse’s station and pulls a DOCTOR’S COAT off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Mitch is pulling on the coat, but it’s way too small.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: C’mon, let’s go -- she went to get a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Hey, go find me a bigger coat.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: No coat in here is gonna fit you! They don’t grow doctors that big! This is crazy -- You should be the patient and I'll be the doctor!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That’s ridiculous. I’d let Dr. Dre operate on me before you.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR DOORS OPEN
dialogues.text: The doors open as Brody pushes an ENORMOUS sheet covered MITCH. He’s so large, his limbs are hanging off the gurne

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Holy shit, where you takin’ Frankenstein here, the roof? Hopin’ for a lightning storm? Brody turns, startled to see a Doctor. He hits Mitch pret hard in the chest as he laughs, but Mitch doesn’t flinch.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Lookin’ for the Morgue, actually.  71.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Down the hall, third door on the left. Harvest that guy, we’ll save a whole village, huh? The Doctor leaves as Mitch’s hand comes out from under th sheet and gives him the finger.

dialogues.speaker: THE MORGUE
dialogues.text: Silver drawers line the wall. As Mitch looks at the file cards on the drawers, Brody goes to the window, nervous -

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: This is fucked up, man -- what the hell are we doing here?! Mitch pulls out a drawer and we see THE DEAD BODY they fo

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Medical Examiner wouldn’t ID him for me over the phone. They’re hiding something... Mitch is examining all over the body, lifting his leg --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come here and help me! Brody reluctantly comes over, doesn’t wanna touch him.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon, C’mon -- Check his taint --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What?! Why?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: May have been stung by a sting ray, they're attracted to the region. Go ahead, lift his testicles...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: I’m not touching dead balls!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Do it! Brody winces, reaches in. We don’t see what his hands are doing but -- Mitch moves away, isn’t really interested in what Brody is doing, really focused on the guy’s HANDS --  72.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's payback for ‘Captain Swim Trunks.’

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: You sonofa --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Wait, look -- right here -- Brody doesn’t care, furiously using the Purell by the doo

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got a tattoo on his left hand. You see the little ‘M’? Means he’s with the Mexican Drug cartel. I knew it.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Shit -- someone’s coming!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALL
dialogues.text: Two Doctors walk by. As they pass, they see Mitch listeni to a dead body’s chest with a stethoscope, pretending to doctor. They pause for a second, confused, then keep movi

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Mitch is on the computer in the corner, Brody reading the number off the body’s TOE TAG, losing his mind --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: #2896 -- now C’mon man, let’s go! Mitch types in the computer, nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Here he is. Marco Vargas. Born, Mexico City. They share a look, then both say:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: ‘Converso.’

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Outside the hospital, Mitch and Brody are about to cross street when they see: FRANKIE looking inside their rescue truck, while LEON is on the ground, underneath the engine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both turn, and start RUNNING toward the boardwalk!

dialogues.speaker: THE VENICE BOARDWALK
dialogues.text: Mitch and Brody chase the thugs across the famed Venice Boardwalk, weaving around tourists and vendors. Frankie a Leon SHOVING people out of the way, Mitch being more care

dialogues.speaker: WATER SPORTS RENTAL SHOP
dialogues.text: Frankie and Leon steal two Waverunners...

dialogues.speaker: SHOP OWNER
dialogues.text: Hey! You can’t -- ...and MOTOR OFF toward the marina. Mitch and Brody follow close behind. The angry shop owner tosses Mitch keys -- SHOP OWNER (CONT’D) Get ‘em Mitch!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: This time I’m drivin’!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Get your own, Johnny Dead-balls! Brody looks over, sees a half-dozen Waverunners. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: gaining on the thugs. Leon looks ahead --

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Lose’em in the Canals! They motor toward the Marina. Mitch & Brody follow them in, just as a LARGE BOAT is exiting. The boat blares its HORN -- but they manage to w around it, barely. The thugs turn hard into the --

dialogues.speaker: VENICE CANALS
dialogues.text: ..-and Mitch & Brody do likewise. The Venice canals are a number of parallel and intersecting channels with luxury bungalows on all sides. The waterways have locals and tourists alike in them, on small paddle boats, etc. VVVOOOMMM! The thugs endanger everyone in their path. An MAN ON A PADDLE BOARD gets knocked off into the water!  74.

dialogues.speaker: GRAB MY HAND
dialogues.text: But the old man just stands up. It’s only waist deep.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN PADDLEBOARDER
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: LEON ON THE WAVERUNNER
dialogues.text: speeding up, Mitch chasing. Leon has to slow to take a ha left into the next channel. Mitch doesn’t hit the breaks though. He actually accelerates, taking a shortcut -- and jumps on the bank of the canal -- purposely landing on th walk-path! SPARKS FLY until he JUMPS the waverunner back the water. Incredible move. Brody coming up -- tries to replicate it -- JUMPS! KSSSSHH! His waverunner slides, badly -- sparks flying -- right toward FOUR HIPSTERS with ironic twisty moustaches reading poetry on a blanket. They stand, horrified. Brody comes to a dead stop. He gets out, tries to PUSH IT back toward the water. No way, it’s heavy as hell.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: You guys wanna help me??

dialogues.speaker: HIPSTER
dialogues.text: No! There’s a consequence to using such an environmentally irresponsible mode of transport!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Yes. I see that -- Brody jumps on his ELECTRIC SCOOTER and takes off over th Hipster’s exasperated protests --

dialogues.speaker: FRANKIE ON THE WAVERUNNER
dialogues.text: looking over his shoulder. Is he in the clear? But when h turns around again -- Mitch is barreling straight for him

dialogues.speaker: SHIIIT
dialogues.text: MITCH JUMPS ON HIS WAVERUNNER -- they lose control, jumpi the canal -- and SMASH into the glass window of a bungalo

dialogues.speaker: ON A BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Brody is whizzing along on his electric scooter --  75. -- cruising one of the many narrow stone bridges that cro the canals. Leon still visible in the distance -- Just then, a GONDOLIER is passing under Brody's bridge, pushing his way with his long stick -- which Brody reache down and GRABS as he passes over him!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY STANDING ON THE BANK, REARING BACK --
dialogues.text: WHAM! Brody breaks the long stick across Leon’s forehead, sending him toppling into the water, out cold.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH SITS UP
dialogues.text: Covered in broken glass, shaking cobwebs. A terrified fam who was having breakfast is frozen -- staring at him. The points up toward the stairs: ‘He went thataway --’

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Thanks, kid. Mitch runs for the stairs --

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Mitch searches, and is GRABBED from behind by Frankie. Mi smashes him backward, and they go at it like the Terminat and the T-1000 in a baby boy’s bedroom, smashing furnitur Mitch hitting Frankie in the head with a TRAIN TOY -- it DINGS with each hit, then ends with a Choo-Choo! Frankie grabs the diaper genie -- CRACKS IT across Mitch’ head. It breaks open, diapers falling over Mitch -- he recoils, horrified, as Frankie breaks for the balcony --

dialogues.speaker: UPPER BALCONY
dialogues.text: Frankie is about to jump -- WHAM! Upper cut right from Mitch's fist, sending Frankie over the rail! Mitch puts his hands on his hips, breathing hard when: Frankie is once again eye level to Mitch in mid-air! What hell?? WHAM! Mitch punches him again, and he falls back d Mitch looks over the rail... and sees Frankie splayed out unconscious, leg hung over the side of a large TRAMPOLINE  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch & Brody are sitting together, looking pret-ty victorious. This is as close to a team as we’ve seen them

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: I gotta admit -- catching those bad guys like that? Kind of a rush.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That’s not why we do this. But hell yeah. There’s yelling behind the door. Ellerbee comes out of th office. He just got his ass torn. Comes to them, points -

dialogues.speaker: SGT. ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: My office -- now! ELLERBEE’S CUBICLE Mitch & Brody take in Ellerbee’s “office”.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You know, I think by definition an office is required to have walls.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: And a ceiling. Ellerbee isn’t amused. Mitch redirects:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: So what’d you learn from the perps?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: “The perps”? Mitch, the only “perps” here are you two. You turned the Venice Canals into the goddamn X-Games!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: We were in lifeguard pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: There’s no such thing as a “lifeguard pursuit”! Police do pursuits! When you do it, it’s just some guys chasing some other guys.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (indignant) What are you saying? You’re just gonna let these guys walk?  77.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: Walk?! You'll be lucky if they don’t sue you for harassment! They said you came at them for no reason and that they were fleeing for their lives! Thank god that nice rich family has rich people insurance --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Look, we have reason to believe they’re involved in the Mexican Drug Cartel running an Op here in the Bay. We have a key piece of evidence we’re calling the ‘Converso Clue’. I just don’t know how they’re moving the product in from Mexico without me noticing... Ellerbee does a complete -- WIF?! -- and turns to Brody:

dialogues.speaker: ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: And you, you believe this horseshit, too? Have you actually seen any drug smuggling?? Brody looks to Mitch -- would like to cover for him -- bu

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Well... No. No, I haven’t, but --

dialogues.speaker: SGT. ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: Leave -- the law enforcement -- to the police. That’s the last time I’m gonna say it. Do your job, Mitch -- and your job only -- or you'll be looking for another one.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE STATION
dialogues.text: Mitch walking away from the station, eyes focused forward doesn’t wanna talk to Brody who trails.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Mitch! Mitch, I’m sorry -- what was I supposed to do?! But Mitch just keeps walking. Brody stops, shakes his hea INT. MITCH’S PLACE - NIGHT Victoria and Mitch are eating dinner together. She looks happy. Mitch looks distracted. Introspective.  78. She's pouring the wine, about to spill. Mitch goes to her and helps. They kiss. But Mitch looks like his mind is somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch is at the lifeguard tower, back in his perch, looki over the beach. There are two-young girls swimming. A wom sun tanning on a beach towel. Slow day.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: More like it, right? Brody closes his eyes in the warm sun and grins. That’s w aman in a woven straw hat leads over a HORSE by his reign a woman riding with her head turned away --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Excuse me! You got a permit for -- The woman turns -- it’s VICTORIA riding!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Victoria! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: I always wanted to ride a horse! This is a horse, right? He didn’t slip me a donkey, did he? Mitch laughs, comes down to her. VICTORIA (CONT’D) I thought we could take a romantic ride down the beach...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That sounds amazing... but I’m on duty.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: You always say that. Just a quick ride...? This is on my bucket list and I’m not sure I'll ever have the nerve to get up here again! Suddenly the horse bucks, takes a few quick steps, and sh almost falls. Mitch runs to the horse, rubs her nose --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Easy, girl. Easy. Victoria, this isn’t safe --  79.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Then get up here and show me how to do it!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Go, Mitch, have fun! I got things under control here... Mitch surveys the beach. Even though it’s totally calm, h looks unsure.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You're still in training...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Dude. Would you just relax for once? Go!

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Please, Mitch...? Mitch thinks, then mounts the horse effortlessly like an hand. And as they start clip-clopping down the beach...

dialogues.speaker: WE PUSH IN ON A BOAT
dialogues.text: Slowly drifting off shore. At the wheel is Leon, his eyes Mitch and Victoria as they disappear down the beach...

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Your turn to chum, Fucko -- for tellin’ Leeds I’m the one who forgot the shoes. Frankie goes to multiple buckets of FISH GUTS and starts tossing the bloody fish chunks into the water -- CHUMMING

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Mitch and Victoria continue their ride.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: What do want to do with your life, Mitch Buchanan?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Well you can’t want to be a lifeguard forever, right? You said you'd never retire, but what about something else?  80.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I... can’t picture anything else. This is what I was born to do.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY IN THE TOWER
dialogues.text: But he’s not watching the beach. He’s on his new cellphon

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: One date, Summer. Mitch doesn’t have to know. And who knows where it goes. Love is as deep and mysterious as the ocean, you know?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER WORKING AT THE SNACK SHACK
dialogues.text: Summer on the house phone behind the bar, long cord stretching -- Sang waiting for her to pick up her order.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Well, that’s kind of sweet in a Mitch sort of way... but my answer is still no...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE OCEAN
dialogues.text: The two teens swimming. And behind them, in the near distance, the first SHARK FIN appears.

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Look, you know what’s best, but even I can see an amazing guy like you, with so many gifts... Well. There are other worlds to conquer. Mitch nods, as if thinking about this for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three sharks circle and tear at the bloody fish chunks -- working themselves into a frenzy. Nearby, we can see the KICKING of the two teen girls --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BEACH
dialogues.text: Brody turns his back, chatting with Summer on his cellpho Betty, an older woman with dentures, looks to the water w sudden concern. She opens her mouth to scream -- “SHHH” B her dentures fall. She pops them back in -- “SHHHARK!”  81. Brody's head snaps up -- eyes suddenly filled with fear - and he drops the cell phone: ‘Brody? Brody??

dialogues.speaker: ON MITCH AND VICTORIA
dialogues.text: They walk the horse along the beach. Mitch slowly turns h head -- what’s that in the distance? It’s faint, but -- VICTORIA (CONT’D) Let’s get lunch! There’s this --

dialogues.speaker: DON'T MOVE --
dialogues.text: In an instant, Mitch is back on the horse -- and starts

dialogues.speaker: GALLOPING BACK TOWARD THE GUARD TOWER --
dialogues.text: MITCH’S POV -- FRENETIC HAND HELD SHOTS As he bounces -- Guard tower in the distance -- closer, closer -- Mitch finally dismounts the horse while it’s st moving -- he comes on the scene -- the world shaking -- t teen girl laid out on a SPONGE BOB SQUARE PANTS beach tow LEG BLEEDING -- she’s YELLING IN PAIN --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened...??

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Shark bite -- Brody is applying pressure -- the world around Mitch goin and out of focus, everyone looking at him -- their eyes screaming where were you??

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: -.--I'm sorry... I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CAPTAIN THORPE’S OFFICE - DAY Mitch is sitting on the other side of Captain Thorpe’s de wearing a thousand yard stare. He’s devastated.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: The girl’s gonna be OK. 40 stitches but... she’s OK. Mother didn’t say anything about a lawsuit. Yet...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: It’s impossible. My girls patrol those waters.  82.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: Girls..?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: The dolphins. What if this was planned? Captain stares at Mitch, as if seeing him for the first t

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: Mitch, I got a call. Did you take Mr. Brody to break into the Medical Examiner's office on Wednesday?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Yes. I’m gathering evidence to uncover a drug smuggling plot --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: Jesus, Mitch! Can you hear yourself? How you sound? I’m sorry, but I really have no choice. (beat) You’re done here. I want you off the beach...

dialogues.speaker: THE BAY
dialogues.text: CJ, Summer, Stephanie and Ronnie sit on the sand. Brody i off by himself. Mitch comes out, and they all slowly stan He passes them like a ghost making his way to -- BRODY -- looking wide-eyed. What’s going on? Mitch extends a lifel hand. His voice is low, flat. His stare glassy...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Brody. The Bay. She’s all yours --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What -- ? Mitch, no --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Thorpe’s call. I’m out. You’re taking my place. Stephanie and CJ exchange a look, this is madness.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: That's... insane. It wasn’t your fault!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I shoulda have been there. (ironic) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A few minutes late to a rescue, right? Brody knows he’s the one who really dropped the ball.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: If anyone should get the job it should be Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Or CJ!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t have taken the job even if they offered it to me. This is Mitch’s beach... CJ nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Not anymore. You’re ready. Just... remember what I tried to teach you. (proud) Above and beyond. Mitch turns and leaves them staring after him. Brody turn Summer, emotion on both their faces --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: This isn’t what I wanted. Not like this. You have to believe me. Summer wants to, but can’t. She walks away from him. And the sun sets, the sky a brilliant orange glow, Mitch walk toward Victoria who waits for him. A tear escapes the sto Stephanie’s eye... .»-and Ronnie starts blubbering like an 8yr-old who dropp his ice cream cone.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS
dialogues.text: And now, we see two different men -- Mitch and Brody -- heading in opposite directions. Brody the new king of the beach... and Mitch adjusting to life off the beach.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Brody's bags are packed, leaving CJ and Stephanie’s place They still look a little upset with him.  84. And now, Brody is shaking hands with a new landlord, gett his key to a tiny rental, right near the beach. Looks aro It’s empty and small.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Looking at himself in the mirror. Not himself, but not defeated. (Not yet). He looks down at his bare feet. He t and sees Victoria with an open SHOE BOX: Top-siders with tassels. They’re awful. He pulls them out, forcing a smil Mitch leaving the house, wearing a too-tight RED POLO SHI pleated dockers. He looks ridiculous. Victoria calling to from the doorway -- Mitch realizes he’s holding his RED RESCUE CAN. He looks back at Victoria, embarrassed smile, she holds up a brown bag lunch for him instead.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY IN THE LIFEGUARD TOWER
dialogues.text: Trying to relax, the new King of the Beach. Takes a deep satisfied breath... but it’s bittersweet. Stephanie and C their jobs under him, but don’t look happy doing it.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH WORKING IN THE MALL
dialogues.text: Mitch is smiling, doing an enthusiastic sales pitch to a TEENAGER who doesn’t look convinced. And now we see he’s pointing to a CELL PHONE stuck to the wall. And as we artfully pull back Kubrick-style, we see there are HUNDRE of phones on the wall. They dwarf him. Oh, the irony.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER DAY, BRODY AT THE BEACH
dialogues.text: He notices the balled up SPONGE BOB beach towel in the sh still blood stained. Brody picks it up. Something strange sniffs it... just like Mitch would. Wondering. No -- he shakes his head, pushing the notion away.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH BACK IN THE MALL
dialogues.text: He’s selling again, lost some fire. This isn’t his thing. He’s in the BREAK ROOM now. Gingerly taking off his top- siders as a co-worker drones on. REVEAL: Mitch’s FEET are comically red and inflamed, throbbing, covered in blister The co-worker takes a look, and nearly SPITS out coffee.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH AT THE SOCK HUT
dialogues.text: The Co-worker is showing Mitch a number of nice socks. Offering one for Mitch to feel the softness. Mitch feels but becomes distracted -- looks back into the main area o the mall, at the splashing FOUNTAIN, a picture of THE BAY behind it, enticing tourists to visit. His beloved Bay.  85. MITCH’S PLACE - NIGHT Victoria and Mitch are having dinner together. She looks happy, animated, talking. Mitch playing with his food. Mi has made a large WAVE made out of his mashed potatoes. It curling over a little drowning person (pea for a head, ca sticks for waving arms). Victoria tries to get his attention. He’s lost. She frown goes back to her food in silence.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY AT THE BEACH
dialogues.text: He’s kicking back in the lifeguard tower. But then -- alm against his own will -- his head starts moving slowly bac and forth, back and forth. Like on a swivel... He zeros in on a guy with a mullet carrying a COOLER walk to two women lying on beach towels. Harmless, right? But he trips -- cooler going right on top of the lady's PURSE and when he picks the cooler up, the purse is gone. DOLLY IN / ZOOM OUT on Brody’s face, the classic JAWS sho

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sand-grifters... BRODY TACKLES THE GUY -- opens his cooler. It’s loaded wi purses and wallets. CJ and Stephanie look to him, impress

dialogues.speaker: MITCH IN THE MALL
dialogues.text: Mitch looks even more beat down, a FATHER with his YOUNG asking him lots of questions about a phone. The kid could care less, smacking gum. Mitch looks up -- the BUZZ of th fluorescent light above growing LOUDER, David Lynch style

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Uh... depends on which -- data plan, you uh... decide to -- (long beat) Have you noticed there’s no windows in this place...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch rubs his eyes, sweating -- can’t concentrate --

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: Well does he get roll-over minutes? Mitch’s heart-beat seems to grow LOUDER in his ears. He's starting to freak out, a full on panic attack -- CUSTOMER (CONT’D) Big Fella? Roll-over minutes?  86.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Don’t get your son a phone -- he needs to -- be aware of the world around him -- keep his head on a swivel -- a swivel -- The customer looks deeply offended (and confused), puts a protective arm around his son. Moments later, Mitch talki with his boss. He’s been fired.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE MALL
dialogues.text: Mitch comes outside, dejected. He closes his eyes, and st in the sun for a moment. Gets a little lift. But not much MITCH’S PLACE - NIGHT Mitch drags in, holding his top-siders. He calls out to Victoria, but she’s not there. He starts moving through t place -- getting worried -- goes to the BATHROOM. There’s a DEAR JOHN note on the mirror. We get a quick glimpse of it and see the writing is crooked. We hear: VICTORIA’S VOICE “,..I'm sorry but you're no longer the man I fell in love with...’ Mitch crumples it, and then gives a hard stare to himself the mirror. Then we see something we thought was impossib His lower lip trembles, his eyes mist over...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER DAY, BRODY IN HIS TOWER
dialogues.text: Binoculars at his eyes, just like Mitch, all business. BINOCULARS POV -- He’s looking at the rocks where the SEA CAVE is located. Where Mitch found the shoe. Frankie and walking the area. Hmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and finds BRAXTON LEEDS with binoculars to his face, star right back at Brody. Leeds waves... ‘friendly.’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody waves back, a little awkward.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CAPTAIN THORPE’S OFFICE - DAY Captain Thorpe is behind his desk. Brody comes in.  87.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Captain? I’ve been noticing some suspicious things on the beach, near the Huntley Club... makes me --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: Suspicious things? You know who you sound like? Brody nods, knows what he means. Stops talking.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, Brody. You’ve got the greatest job in the world. Beautiful girls, great waves. Go relax. Go be a lifeguard. That’s why I hired you... because you get that. He didn’t. Do you understand? Brody nods, ‘yes sir’ but something is eating at him. INT. MITCH’S PLACE - NIGHT Mitch is in bed alone, trying to sleep, clutching his red rescue can like a security blanket, voice echoing:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE IN HIS HEAD
dialogues.text: .--roll-over minutes, roll-over minutes, roll-over minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody is on his motorcycle. Summer rides with him, her ar around him as they wait at a red light.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Look this isn’t a date. The only reason I agreed to meet you outside of work is you said you wanted to talk about Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: So you haven’t talked to him either? He won’t take visitors, doesn’t return calls. Stephanie and CJ even tried to invite him out for the 4th of July, but -- And that’s when LEEDS drives by, and who is that in the passenger seat? Head scarf. Big sunglasses. Looks familia  88.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Was that..?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Brody guns it, and follows them. OUTSIDE VICTORIA’S PLACE From around the corner, Brody stealthily watches as Leeds Victoria go in a small beach bungalow together. Her hair color is different, and she’s covering up... but it’s her

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Brody what are we doing...?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What is Leeds doing with Victoria??

dialogues.speaker: SIDE OF THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Brody and Summer sneak along the side of the house. They at a WINDOW, peering through --

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Why would they -- Brody SHUSHES her. They watch as Victoria smoothly pours herself a glass of wine, moving through the kitchen --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Moves pretty good in there for a blind lady --

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Of course, it’s her place -- Victoria goes to the microwave, types in the time for popcorn. Brody looks to Summer --

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what -- I can text on my phone without looking! Victoria takes the popcorn and the wine over to the couch flips on the TV and starts scrolling through her DVR list Brody and Summer turn to each other, mouths agape --

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe -- she -- Victoria puts on glasses, picks up an iPad. This woman ca see!  89. And that’s when Leeds comes in, throws a piece of POPCORN Victoria and she deftly catches it in her mouth!

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OK, so she can see. In the window, we watch now as Victoria and Leeds KISS! A as we hear an off-screen ‘holy shit’ they turn -- but Bro and Summer are already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MITCH’S PLACE - NIGHT Brody rolls up outside Mitch’s place on his bike, alone, having already dropped Summer off. He knocks.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Mitch! C’mon, Mitch -- open up! No answer. Brody tries the door. It’s unlocked. Only... something’s blocking it. HE PUSHES HARDER -- PSSSHH! Ther was a mound of sand blocking the door. Brody pushes his way in. The place is dark, a wreck. Shad pulled tight. And the entire floor is covered in sand.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The hell -- (calling out) Mitch! It’s Brody -- Brody sees a glow coming from around the corner. SQUAWK!! Brody jumps -- there’s a SEAGULL behind him! (If we saw i we assumed it was bad beach art.) And then he sees him. Mitch is in front of the TV, eyes vacant. Only the glow from the TV illuminating his whacke out face.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you been... taking sand... from the beach...?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Did I...? I don’t remember. Mitch looks like hell. Dirty robe. Unshaven. Beer cans everywhere. Barefoot. And oh God, what he’s eating --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Are you... dipping fried chicken into ice-cream? Yes, yes he is.  90.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I invented it. Mitch takes a big ice-cream covered bite.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You wanna watch Netflix? I’m binge- watching The Wire. I’m on Season 5 but I'll start over if you want... Brody comes to Mitch, trying to get his focus --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: You gotta listen to me, man. You were right. About everything. Mitch’s eyes never leave the TV as he says: Brody time. Mitch Mitch

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No, Brody... you were right. Everything you said. I was just a lifeguard with a lot of crazy conspiracy theories, and now I’m not even that anymore. I let people down. I don’t deserve to be a lifeguard. I’m just a man now, as frail and as human as -- (re: the TV) OH SNAP -- Pooh Bear got CAPPED! snaps off the TV. Mitch looks at him for the first

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Mitch, listen! There are drug smugglers -- on the Bay. You were right! All the crazy shit you said happened on Baywatch is happening. sits up a bit, listening more intently now.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They chummed the water, Mitch. That’s what brought the sharks. I smelled fish guts on the victim's towel. And I can’t prove it yet -- but I think Leeds is involved -- sits up a little more, more intensity in his voice --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I -- was right -- ?  gl.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: We just gotta prove it, man. You and me. We can bring these bastards down.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: But... you’re just a lifeguard.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: No. I was taught by the best. Above and beyond, remember...?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (vaguely remembering) ...above and beyond... Mitch starts to nod, Brody knows he’s getting to him.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Stephanie, CJ, Ronnie, Summer... they need you. I need you. But most of all -- the Bay needs you. Mitch slowly stands up, robe opening --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: The Bay. My beloved Bay.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: (trying not to look) Dude. Your nuts are hanging out. Mitch slowly ties his robe -- deliberate, passion buildin

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I see it all now. We need to infiltrate Leeds’ club and finally shed some light on this maze of shadows... Mitch BURPS, long and loud. Brody waves his hand. On clos inspection, Mitch is pretty damn drunk.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Wait. I gotta tell you something first. It’s about Victoria. (this is hard) Maybe I should put on a pot of coffee -- Mitch reaches out, and grabs Brody by his shirt --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What. About. Victoria.  92. Brody breathes deep, steeling himself for Mitch’s reactio

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: She’s not really -- We’re now inside the CALIFORNIA EARTHQUAKE MONITORING STATION, 75 MILES AWAY. Nerd scientists in ties are playi Magic: The Gathering. Suddenly a NEEDLE JUMPS on the moni as if from a sudden jolt. They look to it, tension high - then the needle drops again. They go back to their game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another day at the imposing Huntley Club.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (VO)
dialogues.text: We gotta go through Leed’s files. His private office is at the Club. We just gotta get past security.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (VO)
dialogues.text: They're gonna be looking for us.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (VO)
dialogues.text: That’s right. Us...

dialogues.speaker: LEEDS UPSTAIRS OFFICE
dialogues.text: Braxton Leeds and Victoria are in his private office.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: You know, when you first came to me with that cockamamie blind idea to get that overgrown Boy Scout off the beach permanently... I thought you were crackers. But you were right. You really did a number on that poor bastard...

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: It was simple. I did my homework, and exploited his greatest weaknesses. He lives to save those who need him most. Had we done something conventional, it would have never worked.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Brilliant. Happy almost 4th of July. This really is the land of opportunity. They kiss. It’s sort of gross. A little too much tongue.  93.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CLUB
dialogues.text: After Leeds’ car pulls away from the club --

dialogues.speaker: WE REVEAL MITCH AND BRODY IN SLO-MOTION
dialogues.text: MITCH: We start on pink cowboy boots. We move up to see p black-and-white Zubaz pants. Day-Glo Fanny pack. Pink mus shirt. Blonde goatee, blonde mullet under a bedazzled bla cowboy hat. He looks fucking amazing. BRODY: We start on high-heels. Smooth stocking legs. Shor green dress covering a sexy curvy figure. Long brunette w framing designer sunglasses. Tasteful (heavy) makeup. Bro (almost) makes a damn fine woman. They walk to each other, serious, ready to do this thing, then we resume regular motion as Mitch doubles over laugh

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What? You told me I had to wear this!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I didn’t think you'd do it!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: You sonofabitch, this is serious --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I’m serious too, that was payback for takin’ my job -- HAHAHAHA! (recovering) OK, OK, OK -- game face. This is real, we’re doin’ this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody nods, straightens the dress. Mitch composes himself sniffs, all done laughing. They start walking together ag and after three steps, Mitch completely breaks down again

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: AHHHHH HAHAHAHA! Where did you get that dress, GamGam’s closet?!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: You asshole! Too soon, man.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Sorry, I’m sorry. OK, get in character. I’m Pappa Bear, you’re Brandi. Roll with it, girl -- He takes her hand and they waltz toward the club together  94.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CLUB
dialogues.text: Brody feels self-conscious. The eyes of men all over him. But... they SMILE, like what they see. Brody smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: (whispers, proud) You laugh, but I’m pullin’ this off. They think I’m a woman.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Newsflash, Tootsie. They don’t think you're a woman -- And that’s when they’re approached by security --

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Excuse me, are you Members of the --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH/PAPPA BEAR
dialogues.text: Uh, uh. You think we don’t see that micro-aggression right there?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- ?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH/PAPPA BEAR
dialogues.text: No I will not excuse your outdated notions of gender identity. Yes, my companion was assigned male at birth, but identifies female -- (hard as hell) You got a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: No, I -- didn’t -- know if you and he -- I mean, she -- you both -- wanted to -- I -- As he stammers, Mitch/Pappa Bear gets closer and closer t him, eyes getting wider -- saying UH?! UH?! -- on every syllable, ready to pounce on any even half-slight --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH/PAPPA BEAR
dialogues.text: Now we WILL BE going into this Club without being marginalized by your archaic and offensive stereotypes, and if one of your Members complains when she chooses to use the Ladies Room?? (dramatic pause) You WILL be hearing from the AFL- CIO and this Club will be your wedding present to us, you got me?!  95.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Absolutely, of course! The run of the Club is yours. Bathrooms, kitchen -- anything!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: ...-that was amazing! I actually feel really empowered right now!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Mitch slips back into the walk-in refrigerator. Opens one the dark barrels. It’s full of FISH GUTS. Mitch sticks hi arm all the way in -- SQUISH! Ewwww! -- and comes up with neatly taped package of drugs.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit -- do we go to the cops?! Mitch puts it back, reseals the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Always throw the little ones back. We're fishin’ for the big one.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS OFFICES
dialogues.text: Still in their disguises, they’re rifling through Leeds’ office. Brody on the computer, Mitch in the file cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Jesus, you were right. This whole Club is a front for a drug operation. He’s not even hiding it that well. Hey -- the word ‘Bundaberg’ mean anything to you? He’s meeting Cordoba there on the 4th. Cordoba is big-time in the Mexican Drug Cartel.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Did you just take a smart pill? How the hell do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: What? 60 Minutes did a whole profile on Cordoba. Look, the meeting is right here on his calender. Dumbass set his password to Leedsl. Mitch nods, really impressed with Brody. He’s stepping up  96.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Bundaberg is a city in Australia. Mitch walks to Leed’s BOOKCASE. It’s full of humanitarian awards, trinkets from Australia, photos...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: We’ll never make it in time, that’s tomorrow. Which is today in Australia... I think. Or something.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: We won’t have to. It’s happening on his boat.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: How do you know that?? Mitch points to a photo of a proud BRAXTON LEEDS holding SAILFISH on the back of a huge yacht. The name on the bac the boat says ‘BUNDABERG.’ Brody nods -- outstanding.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We gotta get on that motherfuckin’ boat. Brody and Mitch look to each other, dead serious, nodding Mitch then BURSTS OUT LAUGHING --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, man -- that wig!

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Brody passes a FAMILIAR FACE working in one of the glass walled offices. Does a double take. Mitch sees --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. I know her. She was my handler. The one who called my old agent and arranged for me to come out here. She works for Leeds? Mitch nods. And then all of this comes together.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That’s why they wanted you to replace me. Because they think you're irresponsible, and their criminal enterprise could flourish under your nose. They’ve been planning this for weeks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Handler looks over as some guy in a dress goes apeshi outside her office, BANGING ON THE SOUNDPROOF GLASS, givi her the finger. He lifts his dress, presses his BARE ASS against the glass. A larger man in a cowboy hat then pull him away. She’s like WIF?! and reaches for her phone...

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch! They didn’t actually want me, they just wanted me to fail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look to each other, bonding over this revelation. Th were both fucked over, but not by each other.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: They got us both, pal. They got us both. C’mon --

dialogues.speaker: AND AS THEY NEAR THE EXIT
dialogues.text: Security is on their headsets, closing in on them -- they about to get caught! Brody sees, acts quickly:

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Discrimination! Hate crime! Free Bruce Jenner! Security turns, scared, as a TON OF PEOPLE ON THE BOARDWA hipsters, street performers, all the outcasts of Southern move in -- ‘Hey you can’t do that / Leave ‘em alone you bullies!’ -- a protesting scrum forming -- cell-phones co out to record the abuse -- and Mitch and Brody slip away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There’s a bonfire on the beach. Mitch has gathered everyo here: CJ, Stephanie, Ronnie, Summer and Brody.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I asked you here because the fate of the Bay is in our hands. Braxton Leeds is trying to take over, to destroy Baywatch. He thinks this is his beach. And if we as a team don’t stop him... he’s gonna turn our beloved Bay into a cesspool of drugs, crime and crappy T-shirt shops. Just like Venice Beach. They all give a little shudder at the mention of Venice.  98.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I have a plan, so take a knee and listen close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 200 foot yacht with the word ‘Bundaberg’ on the back, decked out with balloons and decorations for the 4th of J is docked. A long line of party-goers going up the gangpl CJ, Stephanie, Summer and Ronnie are in line. CJ is weari an incredible outfit, an absolute knockout. But the real surprise is Stephanie -- she’s all dolled up, like CJ, in incredibly sexy and revealing dress. They look amazingly Co See, Stephanie -- I'd told you you'd look amazing in one of my dresses!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: When would you even wear something like this?! Co Sunday Brunch.

dialogues.speaker: AT SECURITY CHECK-IN
dialogues.text: The beefy security guard has an iPad with the guest list we might notice pictures of MITCH and BRODY to watch for) and Stephanie are up next.

dialogues.speaker: BEEFY SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Names? CJ and Stephanie smile, just expecting to be let in. But not budging. Then, Stephanie blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: We're prostitutes. She puts a hand on her hip awkwardly, trying to be sexy, weird unnatural smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: BEEFY SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhh OK, sure. Go on. He lets them in, Summer too. And as Ronnie tries to slip them -- the Beefy Security guard blocks him.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I’m with them.  99.

dialogues.speaker: BEEFY SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Nuh uh. Not you. I s’pose you gonna tell me you their pimp?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Pimp? Pimp?? You just catch a time machine from 1975? Nah, man. You ever heard of Uber? Well I invented an app that delivers the same thing: a fast ride for a fair price. The sex-game’s all online, son. App is called HUMPER™, and my algorithm is their pimp, playa. Ronnie puts out his fist -- and after a moment, the Beefy Security guy bumps it -- and Ronnie gives it a ‘BOOM!’

dialogues.speaker: BEEFY SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Aight, aight -- And as he lets Ronnie come aboard, impressed as hell --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Tweet at me, hashtag ButtWizard, I‘1l hook you up: 50% off yer first blowie... not on weekends!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescue 1 is anchored, Mitch and Brody are in full SCUBA G Brody looks nervous. In the distance, we can see Leed’s y leaving the dock a hundred yards away --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Leeds has chummed these waters before, so keep a sharp eye for sharks. And if you see one, just remember page 73 of your manual. Mitch puts the breather in his mouth, about to tip back -

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Mitch, wait! I gotta tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I know, I was just messing with you. I know you never studied. Just punch the shark in the nose. They’1l flee. He’s about to tip, but Brody grabs his arm --  100.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: I’ve gotta tell you something else. (this is hard) There’s a reason I dropped the rope when we rescued Vic -- Mitch cuts him off with a look that could freeze fire --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- that woman whose name we don’t say anymore. I thought I saw a huge shark, and I panicked. Same thing happened with the girl who got bit. I froze. I blew it, big time. I know I said I was as good as you... but I’m not. How can I be on Baywatch when I’m afraid of sharks? Mitch can see the genuine pain in his eyes. He looks off

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You know, when I was a little boy, growing up, not too far from --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) You were afraid of sharks just like me?? Mitch takes a deep breath, and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You know that’s really rude. Your generation is very impatient.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, you're right, if that’s not where you were going -- please. Continue. Mitch looks off, shaking his head, his thunder stolen.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Yes, OK? Yes. I was afraid of sharks, and my Dad blah blah blah, and that means you’re irresponsible because you’re scared, now get in the fucking water -- MITCH SHOVES BRODY BACK and he topples into the ocean --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch and Brody are scuba-diving.  101. The underside of Leed’s massive yacht in the distance. An then... fifty yards away... a dark SILHOUETTE appears. Knifing through the water toward them like the specter of death. Brody grabs Mitch arm, shaking him --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: (totally muffled)

dialogues.speaker: WHABBB
dialogues.text: It’s coming closer, Brody starting to panic again, bubble erupting from his mouthpiece. Mitch sees it now --

dialogues.speaker: PUUNNSSH IBB
dialogues.text: 20 feet away now -- this thing is huge -- but Brody stead facing his fear. He nods, ready. And that’s when -- VMMMM It passes over them -- and on closer inspection: The ‘Sha is actually a mini-sub designed to LOOK like a shark!

dialogues.speaker: SUBBBMAMMIME
dialogues.text: It’s actually a 25ft Narco-Sub. Yes, these things are rea and drug traffickers do use them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yacht is now anchored way outside of the harbor. Leed standing on the back deck watching as a single-propeller PONTOON PLANE flies in low... and lands on the water. And it skims closer, a long rope is thrown to tie it to the yacht. Leeds plasters on a smile, waves --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DECK
dialogues.text: Leeds is shaking hands with a scary looking MEXICAN DRUG (CORDOBA). Thugs surround him.

dialogues.speaker: CORDOBA
dialogues.text: You got balls asking to meet with me in front of all these people.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: I'm a legitimate business man. I keep up appearances. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And, perhaps, all these witnesses will dissuade you from doing anything foolish. Cordoba smiles, knowing. BRAXTON LEEDS (CONT’D) I think we can agree that the first month of test runs was a success. Except for poor Marco, sorry again about that. But I wanna expand. More shark subs. Let’s double it, triple it! We chum the water, bring more real sharks as cover -- no one will even go NEAR the water again! I‘1l own this bloody beach and we'll be the biggest operation on the West Coast! After a moment, Cordoba nods. Looks around at this great party. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CORDOBA
dialogues.text: You are ambitious, Leeds. I like that. Yes, OK. Let’s party, amigo --

dialogues.speaker: LOWER DECK
dialogues.text: Stephanie is on one of the lower decks, powdering her nos her small cosmetic mirror. But now we see she’s actually using the mirror to look behind her, observing TWO GUARDS standing by a doorway --

dialogues.speaker: MAIN DECK
dialogues.text: CJ is clocking some of the Cordoba’s men as they move dow the food line, others downing drinks. She sees GUNS strap underneath coats. She and Ronnie exchange a look -- Ronnie nods and goes to the DJ. And as music now plays, Ronnie watches as CJ acts a littl drunk, inviting an armed man to dance. They move together deck, CJ’s hands all over him. The thug grins dumbly as Ronnie moves close to them, dancing by himself, doing som his ‘cool’ disco moves -- -- and now we see CJ has got the thug’s gun -- puts it be her back -- and Ronnie smoothly takes it as he grooves by

dialogues.speaker: SIDE OF THE YACHT
dialogues.text: Mitch and Brody are frog-manning up the side of the yacht  103.

dialogues.speaker: ON DECK
dialogues.text: Dripping wet from their scuba gear, Mitch and Brody slip the shadows -- unzip their suits -- revealing they are wearing TUXEDOS underneath, only --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Hey, is your tux soaking wet??

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (never admitting defeat) Little damp. And as they slosh off, leaving puddles, Brody whisper-sho

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Goddammit I had to leave a 90 dollar deposit on this!

dialogues.speaker: STARBOARD SIDE
dialogues.text: On the quiet side of the boat, Mitch and Brody meet up wi CJ, Stephanie, Ronnie. Summer goes to Brody.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, I wore a tux and everything. This has gotta be a date...

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Uhhh, no. And why are you all wet??

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Mitch -- below deck, there’s a secure door, two guards.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: That’s probably where they’re keeping the drugs and money. CJ, how’d you do? CJ produces a bag full of GUNS. Brody grins --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Finally. I'll take the Glock and the Smith and Wesson -- Mitch takes the bag before he can grab it and dumps them one of the ship’s vents.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No guns. We’re lifeguards. We don’t take lives, we save them. (to Summer) You bring the bag from my place?  104. Summer hands him a large duffle bag. We don’t know what's inside, but we’re about to find out...

dialogues.speaker: OPPOSITE DECK
dialogues.text: Braxton Leeds walks with CAPTAIN THORPE, and sees ELLERBE

dialogues.speaker: LEEDS
dialogues.text: Sergeant Ellerbee! I’m so glad you're here, but I must confess, I don’t remember inviting you...

dialogues.speaker: ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: I was surprised myself. This afternoon, somebody slipped an invitation under the seat of my ATV. But if it wasn’t you --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (OS)
dialogues.text: Then it had to be me. And that’s when Mitch steps from the shadows, still looki smooth in a wet tuxedo.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: Dammit, Buchanan! What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I’m here... because Braxton Leeds is a drug trafficking scumbag. Ellerbee laughs, and Thorpe shares it. Leeds stares, hard

dialogues.speaker: ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: That sun has really baked your brains to a crisp. Mr. Leeds is a respected member of the community and throws one helluva party! Mitch’s stare never leaves Leeds --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: No... he moves black-tar heroin from the coast of Mexico straight to the Bay with a 25 foot Narco-Sub disguised as a shark. That body on the beach? One of their pilots.
