Made so many runs, he got the bends. Then someone drowned him. They unload the sub in the Sea Cave right by the Club where they think no one can see. But Baywatch sees. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Drugs go into the club, and Al the chum guy distributes it in barrels from there...

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: I wonder if you know just how crazy that sounds. And you haven't a shred of proof -- you aren’t even a lifeguard anymore, this is all --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Then why don’t we have Ellerbee call his friends in blue, have them check the barrels in your freezer. Could check your computer too. His password is ‘Leedsl’ by the way. You'll have to dig through some pretty weird Japanese Octopus porn, but it’s all there. Or maybe, just maybe... we should go look in the secure room below deck right now... And as Ellerbee turns to Leeds, starting to question --

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: GOD DAMMIT now you’ve really gone and pissed me off, mate! Leeds pulls a AUTOMATIC GUN and trains it on them both --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: C'mon Leeds, there’s no need for --

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up you bloody high- socked simp! (to Mitch) This was your plan?? Expose me to a cop who wears shorts, then get me mad enough to shoot you? Because that’s what happens now --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Not exactly how I saw it go, no. Leeds cocks his gun, this is it. Ellerbee is frozen, does know what to do -- as Mitch takes off his wet tux jacket

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You mind? Like to die with my uniform on. Leeds nods, amused as Mitch undresses until finally weari nothing but his BAYWATCH RED SWIM TRUNKS underneath --  106.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Lifeguard to the end, is that it? Mitch reaches into the bag Summer brought him. BRAXTON LEEDS (CONT’D) AH-AH-AH -- careful there --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Just this -- Mitch pulls out his RED RESCUE CAN. Leeds almost laughs.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Sure. Go ahead, mate. Hold onto your red thingie if it helps you -- Mitch ROCKETS the red rescue can right at Leed’s GUN -- W Knocks it from his grasp, and then -- YANK! Mitch pulls t can back by the rope like Captain America with his shield

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: It’s called... a rescue can. But nuthin’s gonna rescue you -- 4th of JULY FIREWORKS EXPLODE behind him -- money shot --

dialogues.speaker: TAKE HIM OUT
dialogues.text: In a flash, the ARMED MEN from the Cartel close in -- onl when they reach for their guns -- they’re not there! WHAM! WHAM! And as the fireworks go in the background, Mi takes them out with the rescue can one by one -- LOOPING around legs and pulling them out form under -- cracking skulls -- Mitch is a one man wrecking crew. This is epic! And when they get too close -- Mitch gives a steady diet elbows, knees and fists -- BLAM! BLAM! But not ALL of the men are disarmed. And at t sound of REPEATED GUNFIRE: IT’S INSTANT PANDEMONIUM ON TH

dialogues.speaker: YACHT
dialogues.text: GUESTS scatter in every direction -- some even jumping ov the side -- CJ & Summer call out -- Co We've got eight bodies in the water starboard!

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: We've got a half dozen port side!  107. Summer heroically DIVES IN the water -- truly living out dream to save people -- to be a lifeguard --

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: (grabs the ship’s com) This is Lt. Holden of Baywatch. We've got a 346-Bravo approximately six nautical miles northwest of the Santa Monica Pier --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he runs into Captain Thorpe --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: You sold me out, Thorpe!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: You fool -- you sold yourself out! We had a good thing going here, both of us! I wanted you because you weren't like Mitch and you went ahead and turned into him!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Well I’ve never been more happy to disappoint someone -- BLAM! A shot hits the rail right next to Brody -- they bo duck -- Thorpe disappearing into the screaming crowd --

dialogues.speaker: ON ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: trying to digest this scene -- unsure what to do --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Get your head in the game, Ellerbee! I need you! Ellerbee nods, understands Mitch was right all along -- a fights along side him now --

dialogues.speaker: ON BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: As he’s grabbed by the Mexican Drug Lord --

dialogues.speaker: CORDOBA
dialogues.text: You're finished in this game! You can't burn the Cartel like this, all this product is now -- BRBRBRBRBR! Leeds unleashes automatic gunfire into his ch and pushes his still quivering body over the rail --  108.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Mine.

dialogues.speaker: ON MITCH
dialogues.text: in the middle of an epic fight with the oversized FRANKIE It’s hand-to-hand, fast and brutal -- Ronnie sort of circ them -- looking for a way in to help -- but can’t -- But then Ronnie sees VICTORIA -- running down the deck --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Hey! Stop right there you lying whor-- Victoria whips around and SHOOTS Ronnie in the shoulder before he can finish! He collapses to the deck, in agony. Mitch buries a fist in Frankie’s gut, and then judo flips over the side as he gasps. Mitch goes to Ronnie --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Ronnie! You OK?!

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I’m OK, I’m OK -- I’m applying constant pressure, just like you taught me!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Outstanding -- hang on, buddy -- Mitch turns to chase Victoria, when --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Mitch, wait! I gotta tell you something! That day on the beach? When we first met? (confessing) I was masturbating.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I know you were, pal. They share a nice moment, and then Mitch is off --

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Go get her, Mitch!!

dialogues.speaker: DRUG ROOM
dialogues.text: Victoria is below deck in the room where the drugs and ca are stashed. She’s filling bags as fast as possible when -- the lights cut. It’s absolutely pitch black in here.  109.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (a voice in the darkness) Did you know that at least seven million people go blind every year? This is what it feels like for them... BLAM! She fires her gun into the darkness, momentarily illuminating the room in a WHITE MUZZLE FLASH -- spotligh Mitch as he darts across the room!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Number of people who pretend to be blind and get away with it? BLAM! BLAM! More flashes -- Mitch moving like a goddamn Marvel character -- spotlit JUMPING and MOVING -- BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispers in her ear) ZERO. She swings around -- BLAM! BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: What’s the matter, Victoria? Can’t SEE in the dark...? CLICK! Victoria has her hand on the light-switch, the roo now completely bright, her gun trained right at Mitch's h

dialogues.speaker: VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Now I can see.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (OS)
dialogues.text: Good. I want you to see this. Victoria spins -- Stephanie is right behind her! She cold cocks Victoria with a right cross! Victoria drops. Stepha and Mitch lock eyes, sharing the moment --

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry Mitch -- but I really hated that bitch.

dialogues.speaker: CJ AND SUMMER
dialogues.text: are overseeing the transfer of passengers to life boats - Summer helping people in the water --  110.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay low, people! I need a two-by- two formation!

dialogues.speaker: ON BRODY
dialogues.text: Running along the deck -- hears the PROPELLER of the pont plane start up! And as the boat turns, Brody sees Leeds i the plane with Leon piloting!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Mitch! Leeds is getting away! But Mitch is halfway down the deck. Brody takes a deep breath, crosses himself --

dialogues.speaker: BRODY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «--above and fuckin’ beyond... Brody climbs on the rail, heroic -- and JUMPS as the pont plane passes under -- landing on the wing!

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: As the plane moves off, Mitch arrives and DIVES INTO THE

dialogues.speaker: OCEAN
dialogues.text: As the propeller gets louder, Mitch spies the long nautic rope trailing off the plane. He swims for it, grabbing it

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PONTOON PLANE
dialogues.text: As the plane gathers speed for lift-off, Leeds looks behi him and sees MITCH pulling himself out of the water by th rope -- now WATERSKIING BY HIS BARE FEET! Incredible.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: We gotta get him on land! Where he’s vulnerable!

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: He’s an unemployed LA County Lifeguard, not fucking Aqua-Man!

dialogues.speaker: ON MITCH
dialogues.text: pulling himself closer and closer as he skiis -- and just the plane lifts off -- Mitch grabs the pontoon!

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANE IS IN THE AIR
dialogues.text: Leeds looks back, sees Mitch barely hanging on.  111. He shouts to Leon to shake him -- and Leon starts moving stick --

dialogues.speaker: ON TOP OF THE WING
dialogues.text: Brody SLIDES as the plane suddenly tips radically! He sli off the wing, falling as -- -- MITCH GRABS HIS ARM! Brody’s legs dangle over the ocea far below as Mitch does the toughest curl of his life and gets Brody to the pontoon safely! They share a look -- VVVWWWWMMMMM! Oh my God, the plane starts going up, doing loop in the air -- Mitch and Brody barely hanging on -- w whipping at them mercilessly -- but still they hold! As i levels off --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I’m going for the pilot! On my mark! You follow me! READY?! ONE! Two -- ! They lock eyes, nodding as -- BLAM! Mitch's eyes locked w Brody, but now full of SURPRISE -- SLO-MOTION: As Mitch FALLS, revealing LEEDS behind him wi smoking gun, hanging way out, grinning cruelly --

dialogues.speaker: MIIITCCHHH
dialogues.text: Mitch tumbles through the air -- bullet wound in his back Brody reaches helplessly -- Mitch hits the water with a tremendous splash! And just like that... he’s gone. Brody turns with rage, scrambling up the pontoon and ATTA LEEDS before he can fire again. The two men struggle over gun. Brody manages to hit Leeds in the face with a few so blows. Leeds counters with an elbow. During the tussle, however, LEEDS’ GUN FIRES -- HITTING LEON IN THE NECK! He slumps --

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANE GOES INTO A NOSE-DIVE --
dialogues.text: Brody & Leeds continue battling... as Leon, bleeding, doe his best to get the plane to land --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brody is thrown into the sand, badly injured, can’t even stand. Leeds in the passenger seat shakes cobwebs, checks Leon. dead. Leeds staggers from the plane... gun still clutched his hand... ..-headed for Brody who tries to crawl.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Where... do you think... you’re going? Brody squints, blood trickling in his eyes, Leeds yelling behind him -- BRAXTON LEEDS (CONT’D) I brought you here! I own you! You’re a nothing! You worked at a Water Park for Christ’s sake!! And then -- A VOICE RINGS OUT --

dialogues.speaker: SANG
dialogues.text: No. He lifeguard. He Baywatch. Sang comes onto the sand, stands between Leeds and Brody. Leeds starts to laugh ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: You think I won't shoot you, old man? Move aside --

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: You gonna shoot me too?? And that’s when DARNELL and the rest of the basketball players come onto the sand, standing in front of Brody, protective. Leeds can’t believe it -- what is this shit?! Brody sits up now -- can’t believe it as more come -- the sand-sculptor, Hobo Joe, Betty with the dentures -- the Topless Babe and her husband -- All the people Mitch saved, they’re all here -- even the in the wheelchair from the balloon is on the boardwalk -- here, standing up for Baywatch --

dialogues.speaker: BRAXTON LEEDS
dialogues.text: Get outta here, this is none of your business! Go home! This is MY BEACH, you hear me! MINE! And then -- behind Leeds -- something is happening in:  113.

dialogues.speaker: THE OCEAN
dialogues.text: The water shimmering in the moonlight, bubbles beginning form. Something is rising... How is this possible -- it’s MITCH BUCHANAN, RISING LIKE POSEIDON HIMSELF! And that is not hyperbole. Mitch is som rising upright thanks to some unseen force, until he is literally standing on the water -- And just as we’re questioning whether he is, in fact, a god... we see he’s on the back of a rising KILLER WHALE! Mitch makes the clicking sounds, and his ‘ladies’ the Dolphins appear next to him, calling back.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SHORE
dialogues.text: Everyone pointing and staring, can’t believe it, includin BRAXTON LEEDS (CONT’D) He is fucking Aqua-Man.

dialogues.speaker: THE ORCA
dialogues.text: speeds toward the shore, Mitch on its back -- and then, l the show stopping finale at Sea World, the powerful beast LAUNCHES MITCH straight out of the water toward Leeds -- WHAM! Mitch’s bare feet connect with Leed’s chest -- send him hurling back into -- the plane’s still-spinning propeller! ZZZZPP!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they are all spray-misted with BLOOD. They’re repulsed but then perk up a little when they see Mitch shakily sta

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Respect the Bay, motherfucker. Mitch stumbles and falls as all the people he’s saved rus him and Brody and help lift them to their feet --

dialogues.speaker: AFTERMATH ON THE SAND
dialogues.text: Victoria and the Drug Lord’s remaining men are in handcuf being escorted to waiting police cruisers as blue lights flash. What’s left of Leeds is being zipped up and hauled into an ambulance. Brody and Mitch sit next to each other as Paramedics work their various wounds. They’ve been to war together and lived...  114.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: You're smiling because you're proud of me, not because I’m hurt, right?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: (with a smile) A little of both.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Brody! Summer runs to Brody -- hugs him (he winces) -- and she surprises him with a kiss. Brody grins, can’t help it.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: From zero to hero, huh? Best first date I ever had.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: You were the real hero. I saw you out there. You pulled in at least a dozen people outta that water... Mitch looks at them holding hands and nods with approval.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Guess it’s time to loosen up the rule about lifeguard dating, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: Did you learn that from me? To loosen up a little, maybe?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: OK. Sure, I’1ll give you that. Of course I taught you responsibility. How to be a part of a team. How to face your fears. How to treat women. How not to be a cocky dick all the time. But sure, you taught me to loosen up a little. Great job, Brody. As Sergeant Ellerbee comes over, Captain Thorpe in tow --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: Mitch, I just wanna... apologize for what happened. I hope you understand, from my perspective --

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: How much did Leeds pay you, Thorpe? To get me off the beach and put Brody in my place?  115. Captain Thorpe sighs, looks off. Nods, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: Six hundred and fifty dollars.

dialogues.speaker: BRODY
dialogues.text: 650? That’s it?!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN THORPE
dialogues.text: Well, my salary isn’t very big, and you know, I got poker night on Thursdays...

dialogues.speaker: SGT. ELLERBEE
dialogues.text: You know, I might actually have to arrest you for that. You do work for the City, and technically, you did take a bribe... Ellerbee and Thorpe share a look. Beat. And then Thorpe t off running down the beach -- and Ellerbee awkwardly chas him, tackling him -- and as they roll around fighting, bo getting covered in sand -- Mitch and Brody laugh together ‘oooh that hurts when I laugh!’ Ronnie comes over, surveying the scene, arm in a sling.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: You know, even though I got shot, I gotta say... this is turning out to be the greatest summer of my entire life! Co And it’s just getting started... Ronnie turns, and CJ plants the most incredible KISS on h we've yet seen. And everyone else from the beach, they al start to hoot and holler and clap. Mitch gives him a thum up. And then, from behind him:

dialogues.speaker: DARNELL
dialogues.text: Motherfuckin’ Mitch Buchanan.

dialogues.speaker: A PODIUM IN FRONT OF THE BEACH
dialogues.text: The members of Baywatch, including Ronnie, Summer and Bro are being awarded Medals of Honor from the city. An Admir (DAVID HASSELHOFF) in his lifeguard dress whites speaks:  116.

dialogues.speaker: THE ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: It's my great honor to present these awards from the City of Los Angeles to Baywatch for going above and beyond the call of duty... Each of them gets a GOLD MEDAL around their neck from ano distinguished lifeguard (PAMELA ANDERSON). And when she p Brody's on, he shuts his eyes, complete. It’s great closu for him, like the Olympic gold he never got. He turns to at Summer, and her eyes are locked with his, welling up f him. He grins.

dialogues.speaker: FAMILIAR DRUMS START
dialogues.text: We're back on the beach. A golden morning, the sun shinin off wet sand. And as the FOO FIGHTERS new cover of ‘I'll Ready’ blasts triumphantly over SLO-MOTION: CJ PARKER bounds down the beach, smiling. And now, STEPHA and SUMMER join her in the run. But look out, here comes

dialogues.speaker: MITCH AND BRODY
dialogues.text: Running together, stride for stride in identical red Bayw swim trunks. Brody turns, calling on someone to catch up It’s ELLERBEE, off the ATV and running with them, a paine but dopey grin on his face. And then, we focus in on the ocean as it bubbles, something emerging. And holy shit, i

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Only he’s completely ripped just like the rest of them! ( this will be a CGI effect -- Ronnie’s real head on a completely different and amazingly sculpted body.) They high five-each other, Ellerbee reaching into the sur and play splashing them as -- -- Mitch looks directly at us and winks.
